sweet one: ὦ γλύκων you dear silly creature! Ar. Ec. 985.

definition: Γλυκώνειος, α, ον, Glyconic, a kind of verse, so called from its inventor Glycon, Heph. 10.2, Sch.Metr. Pi. O. 1, etc.

children.definition: engraved figure, signet, Eup. 406, Str. 14.1.16, BGU 86.45 (ii A. D.); inscription, AP 11.38 ( Polemo Rex), Gal. 12.773.

definition: γλυμός, ὁ, prob. misspelt for γιγγλυμός, IG ΙΙ(2).142.49 ( Delos, iv B. C.).

children.definition: sweet insipid wine, Phryn. Com.65, Polyzel. 12 (pl.), cf. Ath. 1.31e:—also written γλεῦξις in Hsch.
graving tool, chisel, AP 6.68 ( Jul.).
carver, sculptor, APl. 16.142, 145.
of engraving, γλυπτικὴ σφραγίδων (sc. τέχνη) Poll. 7.209.
fit for carving, of wood or stone, Thphr. Lap. 5.
carved, λύγδου γ. AP 5.193 ( Posidipp. or Ascl.); γ. ὁμοίωμα LXX De. 4.25; πρόσοψις Iamb. Protr. 21.κγ; γλυπτόν, τό, carved image, LXX Is. 44.10, al.: but γλυπτά, τά, quarries, ib. Jd. 3.19.
tool for carving, knife, chisel, h.Merc. 41, Theoc. 1.28; γ. καλάμου pen- knife, AP 6.63 ( Damoch.).
Luc. Somn. 13.
carver, J. AJ 8.5.2, IG 5(1).209 ( Sparta); σφρηγίδων Man. 6.344 (pl.).
stone-mason or sculptor, PMasp. 147.8 (vi A. D.).

carving: carved work, D.S. 5.44, CPHerm. 127 (iii A. D.); γ. τῇ σφραγῖδι ποιεῖν its emblem, device, Plu. Sollert. 2.985b, cf. Iamb. Protr. 21.κγ; Δημητρίου γ. the work of D., under a carving, IG 5(1).540 (Mistrá), cf. CIG 4558 ( Acre).

children.label: II
children.definition: hole cut in a beam, Anon. ap. Suid. v. καινοπρεπές.
of or for carving: γλυφική (sc. τέχνη) Epigr.Gr. 841 ( Thrace).

definition: γλυφίς, ίδος, ἡ, in early writers always pl. γλυφίδες (but sg., opp. ἀκίς, of the constellation Sagitta, Hipparch. 2.5.12),

children.definition: notched end of the arrow, ἕλκε δʼ ὁμοῦ γλυφίδας τε λαβὼν καὶ νεῦρα Il. 4.122; ἕλκεν νευρὴν γλυφίδας τε Od. 21.419; γλυφίδες μέσσῃ ἐγκάτθετο νευρῇ A.R. 3.282; but perh. of notches or grooves for the fingers, παρὰ τὰς γλυφίδας περιειλίξαντες καὶ πτερώδαντες τὸ βυβλίον Hdt. 8.128, cf. Aen.Tact. 31.26; τόξων πτερωταὶ γλυφίδες, poet. for the arrow itself, E. Or. 274, cf. AP 5.57 ( Arch., sg.): also in pl., notches in the arrow-head, Paul.Aeg. 6.88.

data.quote: ἕλκε δʼ ὁμοῦ γλυφίδας τε λαβὼν καὶ νεῦρα
παρὰ τὰς γλυφίδας περιειλίξαντες καὶ πτερώδαντες τὸ βυβλίον

children.label: II
children.definition: pen-knife, AP 6.62 ( Phil.), 64 ( Paul.Sil., pl.).
chisel, J. BJ 5.5.2.

children.label: III
children.definition: capitals of columns, θριγκὸς . . λαΐνεος χαλκέῃσιν ἐπὶ γλυφίδεσσιν ἀρήρει A.R. 3.218, cf. Sch. ad loc., EM 235.13.

data.quote: θριγκὸς . . λαΐνεος χαλκέῃσιν ἐπὶ γλυφίδεσσιν ἀρήρει

children.label: IV
children.definition: Hsch.

definition: γλύφω [ῠ], fut. γλύψω LXX Ex. 28.9: aor. ἔγλυψα Str. 9.2.25:— Med., aor. ἐγλυψάμην Theoc. Ep. 8, Plu. Praec. 2.806d:— Pass., aor. 1 part. γλυφθέν AP 6.229 ( Crin.), but aor. 2 γλυφέν [ῠ] App.Anth. 3.79 ( Posidipp.), Ps.-Callisth. 3.22, ( δια-) Ael. VH 14.7: pf. γέγλυμμαι AP 9.752 ( Ascl. or Antip.Thess.), Pl. Smp. 216d, ( ἐγ-) Hdt. 2.106, but ἐξ-έγλ- Eup. 331, Pl. R. 616d:—

children.definition: carve, cut out with a knife, ναῦς τʼ ἔγλυφεν Ar. Nu. 879; γ. σφρηγῖδας engrave them, Hdt. 7.69, cf. Pl. Hp.Mi. 368c; of sculptors, opp. γράφω, Hdt. 2.46, Str. l.c.; ἔγλυψέν με σίδηρος, written under a statue, IG 14.973:— Med., cause to be engraved, Theoc. l.c., Plu. l.c.

children.label: II
children.definition: note down or write [on waxen tablets], τόκους AP 11.289 ( Pall.).

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., to be hatched, ἕως γλυφῆναι τὰ ὠά Antig. Mir. 97. (Cf. Lat. glūbo ‘peel’, glūma ‘husk’, OHG. klioban ‘cleave’.)
beard of corn, Hes. Sc. 398. (Cf. γλωχίν.)

definition: γλωρεῖν χρονίζειν, Hsch. γλωρόν· νομόν, Id.
γλῶσσα, Ion. γλάσσα, Herod. 3.84, al., SIG 1002.7 ( Milet.), Schwyzer 692 ( Chios), Att. γλῶττα, ης, ἡ,

children.definition: tongue, Od. 3.332, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: γ. λάρυγγος, = γλωττίς, larynx, Gal. UP 7.13.

tongue, as the organ of speech, γλώσσης χάριν through love of talking, Hes. Op. 709, A. Ch. 266; γλώσσῃ ματαίᾳ Id. Pr. 331, cf. Eu. 830; γλώσσης ἀκρατής Id. Pr. 884 (lyr.); μεγάλης γ. κόμποι S. Ant. 128; γλώσσῃ δεινός, θρασύς, Id. OC 806, Aj. 1142; ἡ γ. ὀμώμοχʼ ἡ δὲ φρὴν ἀνώμοτος E. Hipp. 612: with Preps., ἀπὸ γλώσσης by frankness of speech, Thgn. 63; φθέγγεσθαι Pi. O. 6.13 (but ἀπὸ γ. ληίσσεται, opp. χερσὶ βίῃ, of fraud opp. violence, Hes. Op. 322); also, by word of mouth, Hdt. 1.123, Th. 7.10, Arr. An. 2.14.1; τῷ νῷ θʼ ὁμοίως κἀπὸ τῆς γ. λέγω S. OC 936; τὰ γλώσσης ἄπο, i.e. our words, E. Ba. 1049; ἀπὸ γ. φράσω by heart, opp. γράμμασιν, Cratin. 122; οὐκ ἀπὸ γλώσσης not from mere word of mouth, but after full argument, A. Ag. 813; μὴ διὰ γλώσσης without using the tongue, E. Supp. 112; ἐν ὄμμασιν . . δεδορκὼς κοὐ κατὰ γλῶσσαν κλύων S. Tr. 747:—phrases: πᾶσαν γλῶτταν βασάνιζε try every art of tongue, Ar. V. 547; πᾶσαν ἱέναι γλῶσσαν let loose oneʼs whole tongue, speak without restraint, S. El. 596; πολλὴν γ. ἐγχέας μάτην Id. Fr. 929; κακὰ γ. slander, Pi. P. 4.283: pl., ἐν κερτομίοις γλώσσαις, i.e. with blasphemies, S. Ant. 962 (lyr.), cf. Aj. 199 (lyr.): βοῦς, κ ῇς ἐπὶ γλώσσῃ, v. βοῦς, κλείς.

data.quote: ἡ γ. ὀμώμοχʼ ἡ δὲ φρὴν ἀνώμοτος
τῷ νῷ θʼ ὁμοίως κἀπὸ τῆς γ. λέγω
ἐν ὄμμασιν . . δεδορκὼς κοὐ κατὰ γλῶσσαν κλύων

children.definition: one who is all tongue, speaker, of Pericles, μεγίστη γ. τῶν Ἑλληνίδων Cratin. 293, cf. Ar. Fr. 629 (s. v. l.).
ἡ γ. τοῦ ταμιείου the advocacy of the fiscus, Philostr. VS 2.29.

children.label: II
children.definition: language, ἄλλη δʼ ἄλλων γ. μεμιγμένη Od. 19.175, cf. Il. 2.804; γλῶσσαν ἱέναι speak a language or dialect, Hdt. 1.57; γ. Ἑλληνίδα, Δωρίδα ἱέναι, Id. 9.16, Th. 3.112, cf. A. Pers. 406, Ch. 564; γλῶσσαν νομίζειν Hdt. 1.142, 4.183; γλώσσῃ χρῆσθαι Id. 4.109; κατὰ τὴν ἀρχαίαν γ. Arist. Rh. 1357b10; dialect, ἡ Ἀττικὴ γ. Demetr. Eloc. 177; but also Δωρὶς διάλεκτος μία ὑφʼ ἥν εἰσι γ. πολλαί Tryph. ap. Sch.D.T. p.320 H.

data.quote: Δωρὶς διάλεκτος μία ὑφʼ ἥν εἰσι γ. πολλαί

children.definition: obsolete or foreign word, which needs explanation, Arist. Rh. 1410b12, Po. 1457b4, Plu. Pyth. 2.406f: hence Γλῶσσαι, title of works by Philemon and others.
people speaking a distinct language, LXX Ju. 3.8 (pl.), interpol. in Scyl. 15.

children.label: III
children.definition: anything shaped like the tongue (cf. γλῶσσαι ὡσεὶ πυρός Act.Ap. 2.3).
reed or tongue of a pipe, Aeschin. 3.229, Arist. HA 565a24, Thphr. HP 4.11.4, etc.
tongue or thong of leather, shoe-latchet, Pl.Com. 51, Aeschin.Socr. 57.
tongue of land, App. Pun. 121, cf. 95.
ingot, γ. χρυσῆ LXX Jo. 7.21.
marking on the liver, in divination, Hsch. ( γλῶσσα from γλωχ- yǎ, cf. γλώξ, γλωχίς; γλάσσα from *γλᾰχ- yǎ, weak grade of same root.)
talk till oneʼs tongue aches, Poll. 4.185.
endless talking, wordiness, E. Med. 525, Andr. 689, Ph. 2.165; but γλωτταργία, idleness of the tongue, σιωπὴν καὶ γ. ἡμῖν ἐπιβάλλει Luc. Lex. 19.

talking till oneʼs tongue aches, garrulous, Poll. 6.119, Demoph. Sent. 7 ( Sup.); itching to speak, Plu. Garr. 2.510a:—also γλώσσαργος, [ τέχνα] Pi. Parth.Fr. 13b67; ἡδονή J. AJ 18.6.7; ἀηδών D.Chr. 47.16: Sup., Ph. 2.571.
tuneful, στόμα κακκαβίδων prob. in Alcm. 25.

definition: γλωσσάριον, τό, Dim. of γλῶσσα, Dsc. 3.144, Gal. 12.149.

children.label: II
children.definition: spoon or spatula, BGU 162.2 (ii/iii A. D.).
one who uses his tongue as his shield and defence, EM 235.39.
Quint. Inst. 1.8.15, M.Ant. 4.33.

children.label: II
children.definition: tongue or point of a dart, A. Fr. 152.
interlarded with γλῶσσαι, λέξις, φράσις, D.H. Amm. 2.2 [not found], Th. 50, etc. Adv. -κῶς Tim. Lex. Praef.

definition: γλωσσίδιον, Att. γλωττ-, τό, Dim. of γλῶσσα, Zen. 5.65 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Dim. of γλωττίς II, Porph. in Harm. p.273.
inflammation of the tongue, in horses, Hippiatr. 130.
living by oneʼs tongue, Com. ap. Poll. 2.108.
writer on γλῶσσαι, Str. 13.1.19, Ath. 3.114b, 15.699e, Gal. 19.106.
tongue-depressor, Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.14.13.
soothing with boastful tongue, Com.Adesp. 86.

case to keep the reeds or tongues of musical instruments, Lysipp. 5: generally, casket, BGU 824.9 (i A. D.), PLond. 2.191.14 (ii A. D.): more freq. in form γλωσσό-κομον, τό, case, casket, Test.Epict. 8.25, Apollod. Caryst. 7, PTeb. 414.21 (ii A. D.), PMag.Lond. 122.55, etc.; = κιβωτός, chest (Ark), LXX 2 Ki. 6.11 (v.l.); money-box, Ev.Jo. 12.6, Plu. Galb. 16; compartment in a water-organ, Hero Spir. 1.42, cf. Aut. 12.1; cage, Longin. 44.5; coffin, prob. in AP 11.3; rejected by Phryn. 79:—also masc.
sarcophagus, BSA 17.235 ( Pamphylia).

children.label: II
children.definition: surgical instrument, used for reducing fractures and dislocations, Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.20.

children.label: b
children.definition: box-splint, Gal. 10.442, UP 7.14.

children.label: III
children.definition: pudenda muliebria, Eub. 142.
making of mouth-pieces (γλῶσσα III.1), and γλωσσο-ποιός, όν, making them, Poll. 2.108, 7.153.
half a head with the tongue, POxy. 108.14 (ii/iii A. D.).
talking, chattering, Hdn.Gr. 1.208.
tongue-artificer, opp. χειροτέχνης, D.Chr. 7.124 (pl.).
with the tongue cut out, LXX Le. 22.22.
cut out the tongue, LXX 2 Ma. 7.4:— Pass., Plu. VOrat. 2.849b.
flatter, LXX Pr. 28.23.
talkative, babbling, LXX Ps. 139 ( 140). 11, Sext. Sent. 13M.

definition: γλωττήν, dub. in Pl.Com. 239: perh. f.l. for γλωττ<οδέψ>ην.

children.definition: kiss lasciviously, bill, AP 5.128 ( Autom.).
of the tongue, τὸ γ. (sc. ὄργανον) Arist. PA 683a21.
glottis, mouth of the windpipe, Gal. UP 7.13, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: mouthpiece of a pipe, in which the reed was inserted, Luc. Harm. 1, Theo Sm. p.61 H.; of a trumpet, Hero Spir. 1.16.

data.ref: Theo Sm. p.61 H.; of a trumpet,

children.label: III
children.definition: shoe-string, Phryn. 208; latchet, Lyd. Mag. 2.13.

children.label: IV
children.definition: landrail, Arist. HA 597b16.
lascivious kiss, AP 5.131 ( Philod., pl.).
= Lat. fellare, Com.Adesp. 32 D.
tongue-shaped, Arist. HA 528b30; γλωσσ, v.l. in Dsc. 4.88.
ply the tongue, Ar. Nu. 792.

definition: γλωχίν [ῑ] or γλωχίς (cf. Hdn.Gr. 2.431, 437), ἡ, gen. ῖνος:—

children.definition: projecting point: hence,
end of the yoke-strap, Il. 24.274.
barb of an arrow, S. Tr. 681, cf. Sch.adloc., Gal. 5.548; point of a penknife, AP 6.63 ( Damoch.); τριαίνης Nonn. D. 36.111; κεραίας ib. 1.193; of the moonʼs horns, ib. 40.314.
an angle, Hero *Deff. 15.
extremity, πυμάτη γ. D.P. 184; inlet, θαλάττης γ. Agath. 5.22.
stigma of saffron, Gp. 11.261.
barbed, βέλη Paul.Aeg. 6.88.
jaw, poet. form of sq., Il. 17.617, al.: also in pl., Od. 18.29; γναθμοῖς ἀδήλοις φαρμάκων E. Med. 1201; for ἀλλοτρίοις γναθμοῖσι γελᾶν, v. ἀλλότριος; also γναθμόν· τομώτατον καὶ αἱρετικώτατον, Hsch.

jaw, Prose form of γναθμός, also freq. in Poets, γ. ἱππείη Hom. Epigr. 14.13; ἡ ἄνω, ἡ κάτω γ., Hp. Art. 30, cf. Hdt. 2.68; καὶ γ. καὶ τὸ ἄνω τῆς γ. (where γνάθος, = lower jaw) Id. 9.83; ἔπαγε γνάθον take your teeth to it! Ar. V. 370; γνάθου δοῦλος a greedy fellow, E. Fr. 282.5; also ὄνου γ. Eup. 434: freq. in pl., Pl. Phdr. 254e, Arist. PA 664a11.
cheek, in pl., Hp. VM 19, Gal. 2.424, etc.; τὰς γ. φυσῶν D. 19.314, cf. Ruf. Onom. 47, Gal. 18(1).423.
ποταμοὶ πυρὸς δάπτοντες ἀγρίαις γνάθοις A. Pr. 370, cf. Ch. 280; also τραχεῖα πόντου Σαλμυδησσία γ., of jagged rocks, Id. Pr. 726.

children.label: II
children.definition: point of a wedge, ib. 64.
hit on the cheek, Phryn.Com. 28.
full-mouth, pr. n. of a parasite, Plu. QConv. 2.707e, Longus 4.16:—also Γναθωνάριον, ibid.: Γναθωνίδης Luc. Tim. 45.
like a Γνάθων, Plu. QConv. 2.707e.
jaw, ἰοβόλων Androm. ap. Gal. 14.36.

curved, bent, ἰχθυάασκον γναμπτοῖς ἀγκίστροισιν Od. 4.369; μετὰ γναμπτῇσι γένυσσιν Il. 11.416; πόρπας τε γναμπτάς θʼ ἕλικας 18.401; ὄνυχες γ. Hes. Op. 204; γ. δρόμοι, of the diaulos, Pi. I. 1.57; γ. χαλινούς, Hsch.
supple, pliant, of the limbs of living men (opp. to the stark and stiff ones of the dead), ἐνὶ γναμπτοῖσι μέλεσσι Il. 11.669, 24.359, Od. 11.394, etc.
pliable, οὔτε νόημα γναμπτὸν ἐνὶ στήθεσσι (of Achilles), Il. 24.41.

definition: γνάμπτω (in codd. freq. κνάμπτω), fut. -ψω A. Pr. 995, Paean Oxy. 660.8, Lyc. 1247: aor. ἔγναμψα, Ep. γνάμψα A.R. 2.965:—

children.definition: κάμπτω used by Hom. only in compds. in tmesi, ἐν δὲ γόνυ γνάμψεν Il. 23.731; γ. τινά bend his will, A. l.c.; νόον Orph. L. 195; in literal sense, δόρυ γ. Lyc. l.c.; ἄκρην round a headland, A.R. l.c., al.:— Pass., Nic. Th. 423, Plu. Arat. 13.
Hsch. γνάμψις, εως, ἡ, bending, EM 235.55.
curving beach, Hsch.; γναπτὰς ἕλικας· τὰ καμφθέντα φελλία, Id.; cf. γναμπτός. γνάπτω, = γνάμπτω, Id.

definition: γνάφαλον or γνά-φαλλον, γνα-φεῖον, γνα-φεύς, γνα-φευτικός, γνα-φεύω, γνα-φικός, γνά-φισσα, γνά-φος, γνά-φω, v. κνάφαλον, κναφεῖον, κναφεύς, κναφικός, κνάφος, κνάφω, etc..

children.definition: cotton-weed, Diotis maritima, Dsc. 3.117, Plin. HN 27.88:—also γνᾰφαλλίς, ίδος, ἡ, Ps.- Dsc. 3.117.

flock of wool, Jahresh. 14 Beibl. 52, PMagd. 8.7 (iii B. C.). [added from Supp.: See also s.v. κνέφαλλον] :—hence Subst. γναφαλλολόγος, ὁ, flock-picker, Ostr. 1081; more freq. by haplology γναφαλλόγος, ib. 1082, 1086, PPetr. 2 Intr. p.44 (iii B. C.).
bird, Arist. HA 616b16.
dressing of cloth, Pl. Plt. 282e, Sch. Ar. Pl. 166.

belonging to the race, i.e. lawfully begotten, born in wedlock, νόθον καὶ γνήσιον Il. 11.102, cf. Od. 14.202, Hdt. 3.2, Leg.Gort. 10.41, Ar. Av. 1665, And. 1.127, D. 44.49, etc.; παίδων ἐπʼ ἀρότῳ γνησίων Men. Pk. 435; ἀδελφός Ar. Av. 1659; νόθος . . γνησίοις ἴσως σθένει S. Fr. 87; φρονοῦντα γνήσια E. Hipp. 309; γ. φρόνημα S. Fr. 307.

genuine, legitimate, φίλος Phoc. 2 A; γ. γυναῖκες lawful wives, opp. παλλακίδες, X. Cyr. 4.3.1; πολῖται Arist. Pol. 1278a30, cf. 1319b9; γ. τῆς Ἑλλάδος true Greeks, D. 9.30; ἀκουστής D.H. Isoc. 18 ( Sup.); μήτηρ τῶν ἐρωτικῶν λόγων, of Aphrodite, Luc. Am. 19; γ. ἀρεταί real, unfeigned virtues, Pi. O. 2.11; γ. ὕμνοι inspired song, B. 8.83; of fevers, γ. τριταῖος a genuine tertian, Hp. Prog. 24; γ. ὄξος genuine vinegar, Eub. 65; of writings, genuine, Gal. 15.748, Harp. s.v. Ἀλκιβιάδης. Adv. -ίως genuinely, truly, E. Alc. 678, Lys. 2.76, D. Ep. 3.32, etc.; γ. φέρειν bear nobly, Antiph. 281, Men. 205; lawfully, τοῖς γ. συμβιώσασιν Phld. Piet. 93.

children.label: II
children.definition: γνήσια, τά, charges on land, γ. δημόσια PAmh. 86.15 (i A. D.), cf. PLond. 3.1157.4 (ii A. D.).
legitimate birth, ἀπʼ ἀμφοῖν Arist. Rh. 1360b35, cf. Phld. Hom. p.50 O.

children.label: II
children.definition: genuineness, sincerity, μετὰ πάσης γ. Poxy. 140.16 (vi A. D.).
niggard, as pr. n., Luc. Vit.Auct. 23; prob. in Alciphr. 3.34.
Dsc. 3.103. γνόφεον· μέλαν, Id.; cf. sq. [γνόφος]

definition: γνοφίας, ου, ὁ, name of a wind, Lyd. Mens. 4.119.

children.definition: darkness, Chron.Lind. D. 28, Ep.Hebr. 12.18, D.Chr. 34.37 (pl.), Luc. Peregr. 43: pl., storm-clouds, Arist. Mu. 391b12.
darken, LXX La. 2.1.
dark, gloomy, LXX Pr. 7.9, Ph. 2.109, Plu. Frig. 2.949a.
pit, Lyc. 485: but γνύθος, ὁ, hollow, Hsch.

with bent knee, Il., always in phrase γνὺξ ἐριπών falling on the knee, 5.309, 357, al.; later γ. ἥμενος Arat. 921; σφῆλεν γ. ἐπιόντα A.R. 3.1310; γ. ἑδριοῶσαι Orac. ap. Zos. 2.6: in later Prose, Gal. UP 3.15.

definition: γνυπεσόν ἀργόν, οἱ δὲ ἔκλυτον, Hsch.

children.definition: falling on the knee:—hence γνυπτέω (leg. γνυπετέω), to be weak, Hsch. γνύποντι (leg. -οῦντι) · ἀσθενοῦντι, Id., and γνύπων, ωνος, depressed or weak, Id.

definition: γνυφαί νάπαι, Hsch. γνύων· νωθραίνων, Id.

children.definition: mark, token, Hdt. 7.52; test, S. Tr. 593; of an assʼs teeth, Arist. HA 577b3.

data.ref: S. Tr. 593; of an assʼs teeth,

children.label: II
children.definition: opinion, judgement, A. Ag. 1352, E. Heracl. 407.

children.label: III
children.definition: = Lat. groma, Suid.
surety for performance of a service, PMonac. 14.63 (vi A. D.).
a dealer in maxims, Sch. Il. 10.31.

discriminate, discern, σκιὰς γ. Pl. R. 516e (v. γνωμονεύω), cf. Philostr. VA 2.30, Plot. 5.8.11, v.l. in S.E. M. 7.332; τὰ βουλεύματα τῶν πολεμίων Agath. 1.14; γ. πήχει καὶ μέτρῳ τὴν ἀρετήν Them. Or. 2.36b: abs., exercise discrimination, Plot. 5.8.11; decide, c. acc. et inf., Men. Prot. p.47 D.

data.quote: γ. πήχει καὶ μέτρῳ τὴν ἀρετήν

children.definition: proposer of a motion, BGU 362 XV 8 (iii A. D.).
means of knowing: hence, mark, token, Thgn. 60 (pl.); of the teeth (cf. γνώμων III), Arist. HA 576b15.

data.ref: Thgn. 60 (pl.); of the teeth (cf. γνώμων III),

children.label: II
children.definition: organ by which one perceives or knows, intelligence,

thought, judgement ( τῆς ψυχῆς ἡ γ. Pl. Lg. 672b), ἐκμαθεῖν ψυχήν τε καὶ φρόνημα καὶ γ. S. Ant. 176: acc. abs., γνώμην ἱκανός intelligent, Hdt. 3.4; γ. ἀγαθός, κακός, S. OT 687, Ph. 910; τοιάδε τὴν γ. Id. El. 1021; κατὰ γ. ἴδρις Id. OT 1087 (lyr.); γνώμᾳ διπλόαν θέτο βουλάν Pi. N. 10.89; γνώμῃ μαθεῖν τι S. OC 403; γνώμῃ κυρήσας Id. OT 398; γνώμῃ φρενῶν, opp. ὀργῇ, ib. 524; γνώμης ξύνεσις Th. 1.75; γνώμης μᾶλλον ἐφόδῳ ἢ ἰσχύος Id. 3.11; ταῖς γ. καὶ τοῖς σώμασι σφάλλεσθαι X. Cyr. 1.3.10, cf. Th. 1.70; γνώμῃ, opp. τύχῃ, σωφρονοῦντες Isoc. 3.47; γνώμης ἅπτεσθαι affect the head, of wine or fever, Hp. Acut. 63, Fract. 11; γνώμην ἔχειν understand, S. El. 214 (lyr.), Ar. Ach. 396; πάντων γ. ἴσχειν S. Ph. 837 (lyr.); προσέχειν γνώμην give heed, attend, δεῦρο τὴν γ. προσίσχετε Eup. 37; πρὸς ἕτερον γνώμην ἔχειν Aeschin. 3.192; to be on oneʼs guard, Th. 1.95; δηλοῦν τὴν γ. ἔν τινι to show oneʼs wit in . . , Id. 3.37; ἐν γνώμῃ τι παραστῆσαι D. 4.17; ἀπὸ γνώμης φέρειν ψῆφον δικαίαν with a good conscience, A. Eu. 674; but οὐκ ἀπὸ γ. λέγεις not without judgement, with good sense, S. Tr. 389; ἄτερ γνώμης A. Pr. 456; ἄνευ γ. S. OC 594; γνώμῃ κολάζειν with good reason, X. An. 2.6.10; γνώμῃ τῇ ἀρίστῃ (sc. κρίνειν or δικάζειν) to the best of oneʼs judgement, in the dicasts’ oath, Arist. Rh. 1375a29; ἡ καλουμένη γ. τοῦ ἐπιεικοῦς κρίσις ὀρθή Id. EN 1143a19; so περὶ ὧν ἂν νόμοι μὴ ὦσι, γνώμῃ τῇ δικαιοτάτῃ κρινεῖν D. 20.118; γ. τῇ δ. δικάσειν ὀμωμόκασιν Id. 23.96, cf. 39.40; τῇ δ. γ. Arist. Pol. 1287a26; ὅστις γνώμῃ μὴ καθαρεύει has not a clear conscience, Ar. Ra. 355.

data.quote: ἐκμαθεῖν ψυχήν τε καὶ φρόνημα καὶ γ.
ταῖς γ. καὶ τοῖς σώμασι σφάλλεσθαι
ἡ καλουμένη γ. τοῦ ἐπιεικοῦς κρίσις ὀρθή
περὶ ὧν ἂν νόμοι μὴ ὦσι, γνώμῃ τῇ δικαιοτάτῃ κρινεῖν

children.definition: will, disposition, inclination, εὐσεβεῖ γνώμᾳ Pi. O. 3.41; γ. Διός A. Pr. 1003; ἐν γνώμῃ γεγονέναι τινί to stand high in his favour, Hdt. 6.37; πάσῃ τῇ γ. with all oneʼs zeal, Th. 6.45; τίνα αὐτοὺς οἴεσθε γ. ἕξειν περὶ σφῶν αὐτῶν And. 1.104; γ. ἔ. περί τινα Lys. 10.21; πρὸς τοὺς Ἀθηναίους τὴν γ. ἔχειν to be inclined towards . . , Th. 5.44; ἐμπιμπλάναι τὴν γ. τινός satisfy his wishes, X. An. 1.7.8, cf. HG 6.1.15 (pl.); ἀφʼ ἑαυτοῦ γνώμης on his own initiative, Th. 4.68; ἐκ μιᾶς γ. of one accord, with one consent, D. 10.59; μιᾷ γνώμῃ Th. 1.122, 6.17; διὰ μιᾶς γ. γίγνεσθαι Isoc. 4.139; κατὰ γνώμην according to oneʼs mind or wishes, ὅταν τἀκεῖ θῶ κατὰ γνώμην ἐμήν E. Andr. 737; ἄν τι μὴ κατὰ γ. ἐκβῇ D. 1.16: in pl., φίλιαι γνῶμαι friendly sentiments, Hdt. 9.4.

data.quote: τίνα αὐτοὺς οἴεσθε γ. ἕξειν περὶ σφῶν αὐτῶν
ὅταν τἀκεῖ θῶ κατὰ γνώμην ἐμήν
ἄν τι μὴ κατὰ γ. ἐκβῇ

children.label: III
children.definition: judgement, opinion, βροτῶν γ. Parm. 8.61; ταύτῃ . . τῇ γνώμῃ πλεῖστός εἰμι I incline mostly to this view, Hdt. 7.220 (s. v.l.); also ταύτῃ πλεῖστος τὴν γνώμην εἰμί Id. 1.120; ἡ πλείστη γ. ἐστί τινι Id. 5.126; τλέον φέρει ἡ γ. τινί Id. 8.100; τὸ πλεῖστον τῆς γ. εἶχεν . . προσμεῖξαι Th. 3.31; γνώμην τίθεσθαι Hdt. 3.80; οὕτως τὴν γ. ἔχειν to be of this opinion, Th. 7.15, cf. X. Cyr. 6.2.8, Ar. Nu. 157; εἴ τινι γ. τοιαύτη παρειστήκει περὶ ἐμοῦ And. 1.54; τὴν αὐτὴν γ. ἔχειν Th. 2.55; τῆς αὐτῆς γ. εἶναι, ἔχεσθαι, Id. 1.113, 140; ὁ αὐτὸς εἰμὶ τῇ γ. Id. 3.38; κατὰ γ. τὴν ἐμήν in my judgement or opinion, Hdt. 2.26, 5.3; ellipt., κατά γε τὴν ἐμήν Ar. Ec. 153, cf. Plb. 18.1.18, D.H. Isoc. 3: abs., γνώμην ἐμήν Ar. V. 983, Pax 232; παρὰ γνώμην τοῖς Ἕλλησιν ἐγένετο contrary to general opinion, Th. 4.40; but παρὰ γ. κινδυνευταί reckless venturers, Id. 1.70, cf. 4.19; εἰπὲ μὴ παρὰ γ. ἐμοί either contrary to my wish, or contrary to your true opinion, A. Ag. 931, cf. Supp. 454: freq. of opinions delivered publicly, ἑστάναι πρὸς τὴν γ. τινός Th. 4.56; Θεμιστοκλέους γνώμῃ by the advice of Th., Id. 1.90, 93; γνώμην ἀποφαίνειν deliver an opinion, Hdt. 1.40; ἀποδείκνυσθαι ib. 207; ἐκφαίνειν Id. 5.36; τίθεσθαι S. Ph. 1448 (anap.), Ar. Ec. 658; ἀποφαίνεσθαι E. Supp. 336; ποιεῖσθαι περί τινων Th. 3.36; γνώμας κατέθεντο have made up their minds, Parm. 8.53.

data.quote: τὸ πλεῖστον τῆς γ. εἶχεν . . προσμεῖξαι
εἴ τινι γ. τοιαύτη παρειστήκει περὶ ἐμοῦ

children.label: b
children.definition: verdict, ἡ τοῦ δικαστοῦ γ. IG 4.364 ( Corinth, iv A. D.), cf. 685.32 (pl., Cret., ii B. C.).

proposition, motion, γνώμην εἰσφέρειν Hdt. 3.80, 81; εἰπεῖν Th. 8.68, etc.; (but γνώμας προτιθέναι hold a debate, Th. 3.36); γνῶμαι τρεῖς προεκέατο Hdt. 3.83: freq. in Inscrr., resolution, IG 1(2).118.28, etc.; γ. στρατηγῶν 2(2).27; Κλεισόφου καὶ συμπρυτάνεων ib. 2(2).1; ἡ ἐκφερομένη γ. 2(2).1051c26; γνώμην νικᾶν carry a motion, Ar. V. 594, Nu. 432; κρατεῖν τῇ γ. Plu. Cor. 17.
γνῶμαι, αἱ, practical maxims, Heraclit. 78, S. Aj. 1091, X. Mem. 4.2.9, Arist. Rh. 1395a11 (sg., 1394a22).
fancies, illusions, S. Aj. 52.

intention, purpose, resolve, ἀπὸ τοιᾶσδε γνώμης with some such purpose as this, Th. 3.92; γνώμην ποιεῖσθαι, c. inf., propose to do, Id. 1.128; κατὰ γνώμην of set purpose, D.H. 6.81 (so also γνώμης Lib. Or. 33.13, 50.12); τίνα ἔχουσα γνώμην; with what purpose? Hdt. 3.119; οἶδα δʼ οὐ γνώμῃ τίνι; with what intent? S. OT 527, cf. Aj. 448; ἡ ξύμπασα γ. τῶν λεχθέντων the general purport . . , Th. 1.22; ἦν τοῦ τείχους ἡ γνώμη . . , ἵνα . . the purpose of it was . . , that . . , Id. 8.90.
vote by vote, πυνθάνεσθαι D.H. 8.43.
knowledge, ἀφʼ οὗ γ. as far as my memory goes, Hsch. s. h. v.

definition: γνωμίδιον, τό, Dim. of γνώμη, Ar. Eq. 100, Nu. 321, Luc. Par. 42.

children.definition: normative (nisi leg. γνωμονικά) , γ. ἁ φύσις ἁ τοῦ ἀριθμοῦ Philol. 11.

data.quote: γ. ἁ φύσις ἁ τοῦ ἀριθμοῦ

children.definition: dealing in or suited to maxims, didactic, περίοδος Hermog. Inv. 4.3; τὰ γ. S.E. M. 1.278; τὸ γ. D.Chr. 52.17; σχῆμα γ. Sch. Od. 15.74. Adv. -κῶς Phld. Hom. p.15 O., Ath. 5.191e.
give advice, IG 12(7).p.1 ( Amorgos).
speak in maxims, Arist. Rh. 1394a21, Rh.Al. 1439a3, Plu. Frat. 2.481b, D.L. 8.78, Procop.Gaz. Ep. 21.
one must speak in maxims, Arist. Rh.Al. 1439a3.
sententious style, Pl. Phdr. 267c; theory of maxims, Arist. Rh. 1394a19.
collection of maxims, Plu. Cat.Ma. 2 (pl.), Suid. Θέογνις: pl., Plb. 12.28.10, D.H. Dem. 46, Plu. Fab. 1, etc.
sententious, τὰς τελευτὰς γ. ποιεῖσθαι Arist. Rh.Al. 1439a5, Demetr. Eloc. 9. Adv. -κῶς Theon Prog. 5.
measure as on a sun-dial, test, v.l. in Pl. R. 516e (ap. Tim. Lex.).
judging by rule, X. Mem. 4.2.10; fit to judge of, skilled in a thing, τινός Pl. R. 467c, Iamb. Myst. 3.27.

children.label: II
children.definition: of or concerning sun-dials, θεωρήματα Hipparch. 1.9.8, cf. Str. 1.1.20: -κός, ὁ, expert in sun-dials, AP 14.139, Gal. 5.652, Procl. Hyp. 5.54: ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη), the art of making them, Vitr. 1.3. Adv. -κῶς Str. 2.1.35.
forming a γνώμων (II.2.c), τρίγωνα Iamb. in Nic. p.71 P. Adv. -κῶς ib. p.77 P.
Dim. of γνώμων II.2. a, pointer or dial-hand, Hero Dioptr. 5, Procl. Hyp. 3.26 (pl.).
prudence, judgement, Sol. 16.
coin maxims, Ar. Th. 55.
coining of maxims, Hsch.
clever at coining maxims, Ar. Eq. 1379.
maxim-coining, sententious, Ar. Ra. 877, Nu. 952 (lyr.); γ. μάλιστα οἱ ἀγροῖκοι Arist. Rh. 1395a7.
babble of ‘saws and instances’, dub. cj. in Cerc. 9.5.

one that knows or examines, an interpreter, discerner, θεσφάτων A. Ag. 1130; τῶν παραχρῆμα Th. 1.138; γλῶττα γ. (sc. γλυκέων καὶ δριμέων) X. Mem. 1.4.5: γνώμονες, οἱ, inspectors of the sacred olives at Athens, Lys. 7.25.
expert witness or valuer, SIG 169.52 (lasus, iv B. C.).
Adj., discerning, νόος Hymn.Is. 141.

children.label: II
children.definition: carpenterʼs square, Polyaen. 4.3.21; [ ὁ δημιουργὸς τῇ δεκάδι] ὥσπερ γνώμονι καὶ εὐθυντηρίῳ ἐχρήσατο Theol.Ar. 59.

data.quote: ὁ δημιουργὸς τῇ δεκάδι] ὥσπερ γνώμονι καὶ εὐθυντηρίῳ ἐχρήσατο

children.definition: pointer of the sun-dial, Hdt. 2.109, Phld. Sign. 30, Plu. Per. 6 (pl.), D.L. 2.1.

children.label: b
children.definition: gnomon, Euc. 2 Def. 2, etc.

children.label: c
children.definition: Iamb. in Nic. p.58 P.; esp. of the odd integers, Arist. Ph. 203a14, Theo Sm. p.32 H.; also of the original figurate number, Theol.Ar. 9 (dub.l.).

data.ref: Iamb. in Nic. p.58 P.; esp. of the odd integers,
Theo Sm. p.32 H.; also of the original figurate number,

children.definition: Thphr. Fr. 159.
point of a drill, Apollod. Poliorc. 149.4.
index, τινός Plu. Sollert. 2.968f, Ael. NA 6.34, al., Vett.Val. 305.10; simply, mark, POxy. 1409.18 (iii A. D.).
teeth that mark a horseʼs age, X. Eq. 3.1.
rule of life, Thgn. 543, cf. Luc. Herm. 76.
ὁ γ. ἀνίσταται Diog. Ep. 35.

children.label: V
children.definition: tariff, OGI 674.5 ( Coptos), BGU 1118.45 (i B. C.), AB 233.
code of regulations, PGnom. 1, OGI 669.44 (i A. D.).

definition: γνωρίζω, fut. Att. -ῐῶ: pf. ἐγνώρικα Pl. Phdr. 262b:—

children.definition: make known, point out, A. Pr. 487, LXX 1 Ki. 10.8, al., Ep.Rom. 9.22:—in this sense mostly Pass., become known, Pl. R. 428a, Arist. APr. 64b35; τὰ γνωριζόμενα μέρη τῆς οἰκουμένης Plb. 2.37.4.
make known, τινά τινι Plu. Fab. 21; commend, τινὰ τῇ βουλῇ ἰσχυρῶς App. Mac. 9.6.
certify a personʼs identity, BGU 581.13 (ii A. D.), POxy. 1024.18 (ii A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: gain knowledge of, become acquainted with, discover, c. part., τοὔργον ὡς οὐ γνωριοῖμί σου τόδε δόλῳ προσέρπον S. OT 538; τὰ καλὰ γ. οἱ εὐφυέες πρὸς αὐτά Democr. 56, cf. E. Alc. 564, Th. 7.44, Arist. Ph. 184a12:— Pass., Th. 5.103, Men. 72; γ. περί τι or περί τινος Arist. Metaph. 1005b8, 1037a16.

data.quote: τοὔργον ὡς οὐ γνωριοῖμί σου τόδε δόλῳ προσέρπον
τὰ καλὰ γ. οἱ εὐφυέες πρὸς αὐτά

children.definition: become acquainted with, τινά Pl. La. 181c, D. 35.6; τινὰς ὁποῖοί τινές εἰσι Isoc. 2.28:— Pass., ἐγνωρισμένοι αὐτῷ being made acquainted with him, ibid.; πρός τινος Luc. Tim. 5.

definition: γνώριμος, ον, rarely η, ον, Pl. R. 614e, Luc. Somn. 9:—

children.definition: well-known, γνώριμα λέγεις Pl. R. 558c; φίλα τε καὶ συνήθη καὶ γ. Id. Lg. 798e; λόγος γ. τινι D. 3.23; ὀνόματα γ. familiar, Arist. Po. 1451b20, Top. 149a18 ( Sup.); opp. ἄγνωστον, ibid.; γ. ἡμῖν, opp. ἁπλῶς, Id. EN 1095b3: more freq. in Comp. -ώτερον, ἁπλῶς, opp. γ. ἡμῖν, Id. APo. 72a3, al.; -ώτερα τεκμήρια Iamb. Myst. 5.13.

data.quote: φίλα τε καὶ συνήθη καὶ γ.

children.definition: γνωριμώτερον ποιεῖν τινά τινι X. Cyr. 5.5.28.
Subst., acquaintance, ἑταῖρος ἢ καὶ γ. ἄλλος Od. 16.9; less than φίλος, D. 18.284; τοῖς οἰκείοις καὶ τοῖς γ. Pl. R. 343e, cf. X. Mem. 2.3.1, D. 21.73, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: pupil, Ἰσοκράτους καὶ τῶν ἐκείνου γ. D.H. Comp. 19, cf. Philostr. VS 1.24.2, al., Plu. Virt.mor. 2.448e, IG 3.774.

children.label: c
children.definition: kinsman, LXX Ru. 3.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: notable, distinguished, οἱ γνώριμοι the notables or wealthy class, X. HG 2.2.6; opp. δῆμος, Arist. Pol. 1291b18, Plu. Nic. 2, etc.: Sup. οἱ ἐν ταῖς πόλεσι -ώτατοι D. 19.259; less freq. of things, remarkable, Luc. Herm. 21.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -μως intelligibly, γ. αἰνίξομαι E. El. 946; γ. μοι πάνυ φράσεις Antiph. 52.6; ἁπλῶς καὶ πᾶσι γ. γεγράφθαι D. 24.68; γ. μᾶλλον λέγειν, opp. οὐ σαφῶς, Arist. GA 747a27.
familiarly, γ. ἔχειν τινί to be on friendly terms with one, D. 53.4.—Rare in poetry.
acquaintance, Stob. 2.7.51.
making known, Pl. Plt. 257a.
οἰκειότης καὶ γ. ἀλλήλων Id. Lg. 771d, etc.
getting to know, γνωρίσεως ἕνεκα τῶν τόπων ib. 763b; cognition, Id. Sph. 219c.

that by which a thing is made known, mark, token, X. Cyr. 2.1.27 (pl.), Arist. Phgn. 806a15, etc.; ἴχνη καὶ γ. Plu. Herod. 2.855b: in pl., tokens by which a lost child is recognized, Men. Epit. 86, Plu. Thes. 4, etc.: also in sg., Parth. 1.5.

data.ref: Plu. Thes. 4, etc.: also in sg.,

children.definition: corpus delicti, PMasp. 143.16, al. (vi A. D.).
making known, Arist. APo. 90b16.
identification, PTeb. 288.15 (iii A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: recognition, EM 735.25, Suid.
one must know, Arist. EN 1180b22; one may recognize, Alex.Trall. 1.15.
one that takes cognizance of, δίκης Antipho 5.94.

children.label: II
children.definition: diviner, LXX 4 Ki. 23.24.

capable of apprehending, cognitive, Pl. Def. 414c; κινητικὸν ἐδόκει ἡ ψυχὴ εἶναι καὶ γ. Arist. de An. 404b28; τοῦ εἴδους Id. Ph. 194b4; ἡ διαλεκτικὴ πειραστικὴ περὶ ὧν ἡ φιλοσοφία γ. Id. Metaph. 1004b26; ἡ τῆς γ. γραμμῆς τομή title of work ascribed to Archytas, Iamb. Comm. Math. 2; capable of knowing, Plu. Profect. 2.79d, Arr. Epict. 2.20.21; γ. τοῦ μέλλοντος Max.Tyr. 1.5. Adv. -κῶς, ζῆν Porph. Gaur. 16.3.

data.quote: κινητικὸν ἐδόκει ἡ ψυχὴ εἶναι καὶ γ.
ἡ διαλεκτικὴ πειραστικὴ περὶ ὧν ἡ φιλοσοφία γ.

children.label: II
children.definition: corresponding with knowledge, ἰδιότητες τοῦ ὄντος Porph. Sent. 38.
picturing of the effect of a verdict, as a Rhetorical device, Aps. p.304 H.
judicial decision, IG 5(2).262.15 (Mantinea, V B.C.).

fight with oneʼs own opinion ( τῇ προτέρᾳ γνώμῃ μάχεσθαι Phryn. PS p.59 B.), or recognize oneʼs own fighting power (as compared with the enemy): hence, give way, submit, Hdt. 3.25, 7.130, E. Heracl. 706 (anap.), Ar. Av. 555, D.H. 3.57; γ. μὴ εἶναι ὁμοῖοι give way and confess that . . , Hdt. 8.29.

children.label: b
children.definition: admit oneʼs error, Isoc. 5.7, POxy. 1119.20 (iii A. D.), 71 ii 14 (iv A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: contend obstinately, in argument, Ph. 1.526, al.; γνωσιμαχήσαντες πρὸς ἀλλήλους D.H. 9.1 (s. v. l.): abs., to be at variance, Hp. Ep. 27.
obstinate contention, Ph. 1.693 (pl.).
seeking to know, inquiry, investigation, esp. judicial, τὰς τῶν δικαστηρίων γ. D. 18.224; τὴν κατὰ τοῦ διαιτητοῦ γ. Id. 21.92, cf. 7.9, Lycurg. 141; γ. περὶ τῆς δίκης PHib. 1.92.13 (iii B. C.).
result of investigation, decision, PPetr. 3p.118 (iii B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: knowing, knowledge, Heraclit. 56; opp. ἀγνωσίη, Hp. Vict. 1.23 (dub.); opp. ἄγνοια, Pl. R. 478c; ἡ αἴσθησις γ. τις Arist. GA 731a33: pl., Θεὸς γνώσεων κύριος LXX 1 Ki. 2.3.

children.label: b
children.definition: higher, esoteric knowledge, 1 Ep.Cor. 8.7, 10, Ep.Eph. 3.19, etc.; χαρισάμενος ἡμῖν νοῦν, λόγον, γνῶσιν PMag.Par. 2.290.
acquaintance with a person, πρός τινα Test. ap. Aeschin. 1.50; τῶν Σεβαστῶν IPE 1.47.6 ( Olbia).
recognizing, Th. 7.44.
means of knowing, [ αἱ αἰσθήσεις] κυριώταται τῶν καθʼ ἕκαστα γ. Arist. Metaph. 981b11.

data.quote: αἱ αἰσθήσεις] κυριώταται τῶν καθʼ ἕκαστα γ.

children.label: III
children.definition: being known, γνῶσιν ἔχει τι, = γνωστόν ἐστι, Pl. Tht. 206b.
fame, credit, Hdn. 7.5.5, Luc. Herod. 3.

children.label: IV
children.definition: means of knowing: hence, statement in writing, PLond. 5.1708, etc. (vi A. D.).

children.label: V
children.definition: Hsch. s. h. v.
knowable object, Dam. Pr. 81.
certification of identity, PFay. 65.5 (ii A. D.).
one must know, Pl. R. 396a. Adj. γνωστέα, τά, things that must be known, Gal. 17(2).1.
to be witness to identity for a person, BGU 895 (ii A. D.):— Pass., to be certified, ὑπό τινος PFlor. 382.80 (iii A. D.).
one that knows: surety, X. Cyr. 6.2.39, BGU 1032.11: witness to identity, POxy. 496.16 (ii A. D.).
inspector, PAmh. 2.139.23 (iv A. D.), PLond. 3.1249.3 (iv A. D.).
one that knows, τῶν ἐθῶν Act.Ap. 26.3; τοῦ εὐαγγελίου Sammelb. 421.1 (iii A. D.): esp. one who knows the future, diviner, LXX 1 Ki. 28.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: surety, γ. τῆς πίστεως Plu. Flam. 4; expert witness or valuer, PLips. 106.10 (i A. D.).

of or for knowing, cognitive: ἡ -κή (sc. ἐπιστήμη), theoretical science (opp. πρακτική), Pl. Plt. 258e, etc.; τὸ γ. ib. 261b; ἕξεις γ. Arist. APo. 100a11 ( Comp.); γ. εἰκόνες Hierocl. in CA 25p.475M.: c. gen., able to discern, Ocell. 2.7. Adv. -κῶς Procl. Inst. 39, Dam. Pr. 79, Phlp. in Ph. 241.22.
creating the knowable, Dam. Pr. 80.

definition: γνωστός, ή, όν, collat. form of γνωτός (q. v.),

children.definition: known, A. Ch. 702, S. OT 361, Fr. 203, Pl. Tht. 205d, X. HG 2.3.44, etc.; γνωστόν, τό, common knowledge, τινός PAmh. 145.9 (iv/v A. D.). Adv. -τῶς clearly, LXX Pr. 27.23, Eust. 1540.1.
knowable, Arist. Metaph. 1016b20, APo. 64b37, etc.; γνωστὰ σαρκός bodily symptoms (of anger), Phld. Ir. p.24 W.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., = γνώριμοι, notables, Sm. Pr. 31.23; acquaintance, friend, Ev.Luc. 2.44, al.

suffering from or subject to, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.22.3, J. BJ 6.9.3 (v.l. -οιοις) ; πάθος Ruf. Sat.Gon. 15.
to be subject to spermatorrhoea, LXX Le 22.4 (v.l.), Sch. Nic. Th. 721.

definition: γόνος, ὁ, and (in signf. 1), ἡ, E. IA 793: late Ion. γοῦνος Aret. CD 2.5: —

children.definition: that which is begotten, child, Il. 5.635, 6.191; offspring, 20.409, Hes. Th. 919, etc.; ἄπαις ἔρσενος γόνου Hdt. 1.109; πρεσβύτατος παντὸς τοῦ γ. Id. 7.2; αὐτὸν καὶ γόνον Schwyzer 415 ( Elis); ὁ Πηλέως γ. his son, S. Ph. 333, cf. 366, 416, etc.; of animals, γ. ὀρταλίχων Id. Fr. 793; of fish, roe, Hegem. 1, Archestr. Fr. 9; of bees, Arist. HA 554a18.
product, of plants, γ. ἀμπέλου Anacreont. 54.7; γ. πλουτόχθων, of the silver mines at Laureion, A. Eu. 946 (lyr.); τοῦ φόρου τὸν γ. Ar. V. 1116 codd.
ἐς ἔρσενα γόνον to any of the male sex, Hdt. 6.135.

children.label: II
children.definition: race, stock, descent, οὔ πώ τις ἑὸν γ. αὐτὸς ἀνέγνω Od. 1.216, cf. 11.234.

data.quote: οὔ πώ τις ἑὸν γ. αὐτὸς ἀνέγνω

children.label: III
children.definition: begetting, procreation, A. Supp. 172 (lyr.); γόνῳ πατήρ, opp. ποιητός, Lys. 13.91; γόνῳ γεγονώς D. 44.49; γ. υἱός Men. Sam. 131, D.C. 40.51, cf. IG 3.1445, al.
bearing, Thphr. CP 3.15.3.

children.label: IV
children.definition: seed, Hp. Genit. 7, Arist. GA 748a22, LXX Le. 15.3; σπέρμα καὶ γ. Ti.Locr. 100b, cf. Gal. 19.450.
genitals, Hp. Liqu. 2.

children.label: V
children.definition: γ. Ἑρμοῦ, = βούφθαλμος, Ps.- Dsc. 3.139.
callus on the knee, Hsch.

definition: γόνυ, τό, gen. γόνατος, Ep. and Ion. γούνατος (for γόνϝατος) Il. 21.591, Hdt. 2.80: pl. nom. γούνατα Il. 5.176, Hes. Op. 587, Hdt. 1.199, Schwyzer 694.7 ( Chios, iv B. C.), gen. γουνάτων Hdt. 9.76, dat. γούνασι Il. 9.455, Hdt. 4.152 (also Pi. I. 2.26), γονάτεσσι Theoc. 16.11, Epigr.Gr. 782 (Halic.); also Ep. gen. γουνός (expl. as for γόνυος by Hdn.Gr. 2.768, A.D. Synt. 342.9) Il. 11.547: pl. γοῦνα 6.511; γούνων 1.407, al.: dat. γούνεσσι 9.488, al. (v.l. γούνασσι):— Aeol. acc. pl. γόνα Alc. 39.7 (prob.): gen. pl. γόνων Alc. 44.7 L.-P., hyper-Aeol. acc. pl. γόννα acc. to St.Byz. s.v. γόννοι, Eust. 335.39; dat.pl. γόννοις Theoc. 30.18: S. has γούνατα OC 1607, E. has γουνάτων Hec. 752, 839, γούνασι Supp. 285 (lyr.), Andr. 529 (lyr.), but not γουνός ( γοῦνʼ acc. pl. was read by Sch. in Ph. 852): gen. pl. γεύνων, Hsch.:—

children.definition: knee, γόνυ γουνὸς ἀμείβων Il. 11.547, etc.: freq. of clasping the knees in earnest supplication, ἥψατο γούνων 1.512; ἑλεῖν, λαβεῖν γούνων 21.71, 1.407, etc.; τῶν γουνάτων λαβέσθαι Hdt. 9.76; ποτὶ (v.l. περὶ) or ἀμφὶ γούνασί τινος χεῖρας βαλεῖν Od. 6.310, 7.142; περὶ γόνυ χέρας ἱκεσίους ἔβαλον E. Or. 1414, cf. Ph. 1622, etc.; τὰ σὰ γούναθʼ ἱκάνομαι Il. 18.457, cf. Od. 7.147, etc.; κιχανόμενοι τὰ σὰ γοῦνα ἱκόμεθʼ 9.266; ἀντίος ἤλυθε γούνων Il. 20.463; γόνυ σὸν ἀμπίσχειν χερί E. Supp. 165; σοῖς προστίθημι γόνασιν ὠλένας Id. Andr. 895; ἐς γούνατά τινι or τινος πεσεῖν Hdt. 5.86, S. OC 1607; ἀμφὶ γόνυ τινὸς πίπτειν E. Hec. 787; γόνυ τινός or πρὸς γόνυ προσπίπτειν ib. 339, HF 79; γόνασί τινος προσπίπτειν Id. Or. 1332 (but προσπίτνω σε γόνασιν on my knees, S. Ph. 485); πίπτειν πρὸς τὰ γ. τινος, τινι, Lys. 1.19, D. 19.198; also γούνων λίσσεσθαι Il. 9.451; ἐλλιτανεύειν Od. 10.481; γουνάζεσθαι Il. 22.345; ἄντεσθαι πρὸς τῶν γονάτων E. Med. 710; ἱκετεῦσαι πρὸς τ. γ. D. 58.70.

φημί μιν ἀσπασίως γ. κάμψειν will be glad to bend the knee so as to sit down and rest, Il. 7.118, cf. 19.72; but also, bow the knee in submission, ἐμοὶ κάμψει (intr.) πᾶν γ. LXX Is. 45.23; γ. ὀκλάζειν τινί ib. 3 Ki. 19.18, v. sub κάμπτω: ἐπὶ γούνασι on oneʼs knees, ἐπὶ γούνασι πατρός Il. 22.500; ποτὶ γ. 5.408; γούνασιν ἐφέσσεσθαι φίλον υἱόν 9.455; σʼ ἐπʼ ἐμοῖσι . . γούνεσσι καθίσσας 9.488; τόν ῥά οἱ . . ἐπὶ γούνασι θῆκεν Od. 19.401; ἐν τοῖς γόνασί τινος στρέφεσθαι Pl. R. 617b; πέπλον . . θεῖναι Ἀθηναίης ἐπὶ γούνασιν to lay it on her lap (as an offering), Il. 6.92, cf. Schwyzer l.c.: hence metaph., θεῶν ἐν γούνασι κεῖται it rests in the lap of . . , Il. 17.514, Od. 1.267, etc.; but ἐν γούνασιν πίτνοντα Νίκας victorious, Pi. I. 2.26.

data.quote: τόν ῥά οἱ . . ἐπὶ γούνασι θῆκεν

children.definition: ἐν δὲ βίην ὤμοισι καὶ ἐν γούνεσσιν ἔθηκε Il. 17.569; of swiftness, λαιψηρά γ. 22.204, etc.; γούνατά τινος λύειν disable, kill him, 5.176, etc.; ὑπὸ γούνατʼ ἔλυσεν 11.579; βλάπτειν γ. τινι, κάματος δʼ ὑπὸ γ. ἐδάμνα, 7.271, 21.52:— Pass., αὐτοῦ λύτο γούνατα 21.114, etc.

data.quote: ἐν δὲ βίην ὤμοισι καὶ ἐν γούνεσσιν ἔθηκε

children.definition: ἐς γόνυ βάλλειν bring down upon the knee, i. e. humble, conquer, Hdt. 6.27; ἐς γ. ῥίπτειν, κλίνειν, App. BC 3.20, 30; ἐς γ. ἐλθεῖν Procop. Arc. 14, Pers. 1.17; Ἀσία δὲ χθὼν . . ἐπὶ γόνυ κέκλιται A. Pers. 931 (lyr.).

data.quote: Ἀσία δὲ χθὼν . . ἐπὶ γόνυ κέκλιται

children.definition: ἀπωτέρω ἢ γόνυ κνάμα ‘blood is thicker than water’, ‘charity begins at home’, Theoc. 16.18; γ. κνήμης ἔγγιον Arist. EN 1168b8, Ath. 9.383b.

children.label: II
children.definition: joint of grasses or plants, Hdt. 3.98, X. An. 4.5.26, Thphr. HP 8.2.4, Porph. Antr. 19. (Cf. Skt. já̄nu, Lat. genu, etc.)
suffering pain in the knee, Hp. Epid. 6.4.11.
twisting the knee awry, of the gout, Luc. Trag. 203.
keeping awake by inflammation of the knee, Luc. Trag. 201.
bend the knee, Eust. 669.32.
on bended knee, γ. ἐχόμενός τινος POxy. 1089.31 (iii A. D.).
Simp. in Epict. p.107 D.
knocking the knees together, of the gait of women, Arist. HA 538b10 ( Comp.); of effeminate men. Anacr. 144, Arist. Phgn. 808a13, 810a34.
fall on the knee, Plb. 15.29.9, etc.
fall down before one, τινά Ev.Matt. 17.14, cf. Ev.Marc. 1.40: abs., Corn. ND 12.
falling on the knee, Tim. Pers. 189; ἕδραι γ. a kneeling posture, E. Ph. 293.
ruscus, Gloss.
Hp. Coac. 446.

definition: γονώνη ὀρίγανος, Hsch. γόον, v. γοάω.

children.definition: weeping, wailing, σχέθε δʼ ὄσσε γόοιο Od. 4.758; also of louder signs of grief, ib. 103; ἐρικλάγκταν γόον Pi. P. 12.21; ἀρίδακρυς γ., πολύδακρυς γ., A. Pers. 949 (lyr.), Ch. 449 (lyr.); γόους δακρύειν S. Aj. 579; οἰκτρᾶς γ. ὄρνιθος, of the nightingale, ib. 629 (lyr.); γ. τινός grief for one, Q.S. 3.644; so γόους πρὸς αὐτὴν [τούτων] θησόμεσθʼ, ἃ πάσχομεν for our sufferings, E. Or. 1121: in late Prose, LXX 3 Ma. 1.18 (pl.), al.

definition: γοράπιες ῥάφανοι, Hsch. γοράτου· ἠφινόν, οἱ δὲ ῥανῶ, Id.

children.definition: Phot. s.v. πλόκιον Γοργάδος: pl., E. Hyps.Fr. 41 (64).77.
ἡ παλίμφρων Γ., of Hera, Lyc. 1349.

children.label: II
children.definition: sea-nymphs, S. Fr. 163:—also Γοργίδες, Hsch.
of or belonging to the Gorgon, Γοργείη κεφαλή Il. 5.741, Od. 11.634; Γόργειον, τό, a Tragic mask, EM 238.46, Poll. 10.167, etc.
move rapidly, hasten, Sm. Ec. 10.10, Hsch.
busy oneself, τινί or μετά τινος PPar. 18.6.12 (ii A. D.).
agilitas, Gloss.
speak like Gorgias, Philostr. VS 1.16.2.
of Gorgias, Gorgias-like, ῥήματα X. Smp. 2.26; σχήματα D.H. Dem. 5; of vases, called after one Gorgias, IG 11(2).128.31, al. ( Delos, iii B. C.).
he of the Gorgon-crest, Ar. Ach. 567:—fem. Γοργολόφα, ης, ἡ, Id. Eq. 1181.
coral, Plin. HN 37.164: Γοργονιὰς βοτάνη, Gorgon-like plant, Dam. Isid. 68.

A. Pr. 793; τὸ Γ. a Gorgon-mask, IG 2.654, al., cf. Plu. Them. 10; the Gorgonʼs head, a group of stars in Perseus, Gem. 3.11, Ptol. Alm. 7.5, etc., Plu. Them. 10; but also, the constellation Medusa, Hipparch. 2.3.27, al.; bogey, Ruf. ap. Orib. inc. 20.27; Orphic name for the moon, because of the face in it, Orph. Fr. 33.

data.ref: Plu. Them. 10; but also, the constellation

children.label: II
children.definition: Γ., τό, = λιθόσπερμον, Ps.- Dsc. 3.141.
Hdn. Epim. 17, Suid.
Gorgon-like, Sch. E. Ph. 146.

definition: Γοργόνωτος ἀσπίδος κύκλος, ἡ, a shield

children.definition: with the Gorgon on it, Ar. Ach. 1124.
to be spirited, of a horse, X. Eq. 10.4.

grim, fierce, terrible, γ. ὄμμʼ ἔχων, of Parthenopaeus, A. Th. 537; ὄμμασι γοργός E. Ph. 146 (lyr.); τοῖς κερτομοῦσι γοργὸν ὡς ἀναβλέπει looks fiercely at . . , dub. l. in Id. Supp. 322; γοργότεροι ἰδεῖν, ὁρᾶσθαι, terrible to behold, X. Cyr. 4.4.3, Smp. 1.10; γοργὸν βλέπειν look terrible, Ael. VH 2.44; of horses, γ. ἰδεῖν X. Eq. 10.17; ἵππου γ. βλέμμα Poll. 1.192; in Ephebic Inscrr., φίλοι, γοργοί, γνήσιοι, IG 3.1079.
spirited, vigorous, of persons, Luc. DDeor. 11[7].3, Asin. 8; of animals, PRyl. 238.9 (iii A. D.); quick, c. inf., γ. ἐπινοεῖν Procop. Arc. 16. Adv. -γῶς, τρέχειν Choerob.Rh. p.247 S.
vehement, vigorous, v.l. in D.H. Comp. 19 ( Comp.), Hermog. Id. 1.11, 2.1 ( Comp.). Adv. -γῶς Syrian. in Metaph. 130.6, Eust. 1082.5, etc.
rapidity, Sm. Ec. 2.21, Gloss.

children.label: II
children.definition: vehemence, vigour, Hermog. Id. 2.1, Procl. in Prm. p.509 S., Sch. Od. 1.110, etc.
cutting off the Gorgonʼs head, Str. 8.6.2.
Suid. s.v. γοργῶπις.
Gorgon-killing, E. Fr. 985: fem. Γοργοφόνα, as a name of Athena, Id. Ion 1478 (lyr.).
underground drain or sewer, Alcm. 132, cf. AB 233, Hsch.: used as a dungeon, Hdt. 3.145, cf. Harp., etc.

the Gorgon, i.e. the Grim One (cf. γοργός), Hes. Sc. 224, 230: acc. pl., Γοργούς Id. Th. 276.—Sg. Γοργώ Il. 11.36: gen. Γοργοῦς 8.349, Hes. Sc. 224, E. Or. 1521, Ion 1003, etc.; also Γοργών Id. Rh. 306: gen. Γοργόνος Id. Fr. 360.46, Ph. 456 (s. v.l.): acc. Γοργόνα Id. Or. 1520: pl. Γοργόνες, acc. -ας, are the regul. forms (but v. supr.), Hes. Sc. 230, A. Pr. 799, al.: gen. Γοργόνων Pi. P. 12.7, E. Ba. 990 (lyr.).
fierce-eyed, grim-eyed, σέλας A. Pr. 358; κόραι E. HF 868; ἴτυς Id. Ion 210 (lyr.); γοργωπὰ λεύσσων Id. Hyps.Fr. 16(18); ἀλέκτωρ AP 7.428 ( Mel.); τὸ γ. Corn. ND 20.

definition: γοργώψ, ῶπος, ὁ, ἡ, = foreg., E. El. 1257, Or. 261:—fem. γοργ-ῶπις, ιδος, of Athena, S. Aj. 450, Fr. 844.
γοργώψατο πικρὸν ἔβλεψε, Hsch. γορδελίζειν· ἀδολεσχεῖν, Id.
Γόριλλαι, αἱ, name of a tribe of hairy women (but prob.

children.definition: gorilla), Hanno Peripl. 18.

definition: γορός κυρτός, Hsch., Cyr., Zonar. (Perh. f.l. for γυρός.)
Γορπιαῖος, ὁ (sc. μήν), name of a Macedonian month, J. BJ 2.17.8, Plu. Thes. 20, etc.; at Nysa, SIG 781.4 (i B. C.).
γόρτυξ ὄρτυξ, Hsch. γόρυνος· μῦς, βάτραχος, Id.; ὁ μικρὸς βάτραχος, Zonar. (Cf. γύρινος.)
γορυνίας, Boeotian name for μυρσίνη ἀγρία, Ps.- Dsc. 2.110.

children.definition: stocks from which olive-trees are struck (Aram. gerōphīth), Gp. 9.5.12.

definition: γουβενάριον, τό, dub. in POxy. 921 Intr. (iii A. D.).
γουβικός, f.l. for κυβικός, Hero Stereom. 1.48.
γοῦν or γʼ οὖν, Ion. and Dor. γῶν ( γε οὖν); restrictive Particle with an inferential force,

children.definition: at least then, freq. scarcely distinguishable from simple γε: twice in Hom. (with a second γε added), εἴ γʼ οὖν ἕτερός γε φύγῃσιν Il. 5.258; μὴ ἐμέ γʼ οὖν οὗτός γε 16.30 (so ἔοικα γοῦν τούτου γε . . σοφώτερος εἶναι Pl. Ap. 21d); freq. later, δοκέων πάγχυ δευτερεῖα γῶν οἴσεσθαι Hdt. 1.31; γνώσει . . ὀψὲ γοῦν τὸ σωφρονεῖν A. Ag. 1425, cf. 432 (lyr.), etc.; freq. in adducing an instance, or a fact giving rise to a presumption, Heraclit. 58, Th. 1.2, X. Cyr. 1.5.8; τὸν γοῦν ἄλλον χρόνον in past time at all events, D. 20.16; emphasizing a personal or possessive pronoun, τὸ γ. ἐμόν S. OT 626, cf. Ant. 45; introducing an apodosis, Pl. Alc. 1.112b; simply emphatic, why yes, E. Ph. 618, Pl. Sph. 219d, etc.; each Particle has its full force in τὰς γοῦν Ἀθήνας οἶδα well ( οὖν), I know Athens ( γε), S. OC 24:—freq. separated by a word, πάνυ γʼ ἂν οὖν Ar. Ec. 806, cf. Th. 1.76, etc.:— rarely γε οὖν in full, D.H. 2.56 codd. (The negat. form is οὔκουν . . γε.)

data.quote: εἴ γʼ οὖν ἕτερός γε φύγῃσιν
μὴ ἐμέ γʼ οὖν οὗτός γε
ἔοικα γοῦν τούτου γε . . σοφώτερος εἶναι

definition: γοῦνα, γούνων, poet. pl. of γόνυ (q. v.).
γουνάζομαι, fut. -σομαι: aor. 1 γουνασάμεσθα Orph. A. 618, subj. γουνάσσηαι A.R. 4.747, cf. Orph. A. 943: ( γόνυ):—

children.definition: Ep. Verb, clasp anotherʼs knees (v. sub γόνυ I.2): hence, implore, entreat, abs., Il. 11.130: c. inf., τῶν ὕπερ . . γουνάζομαι οὐ παρεόντων ἑστάμεναι κρατερῶς in whose name . . I implore you to stand your ground, 15.665; νῦν δέ σε πρὸς πατρὸς γουνάζομαι Od. 13.324; νῦν δέ σε τῶν ὄπιθεν γ., . . πρός τʼ ἀλόχου καὶ πατρός 11.66; μή με . . γούνων γουνάζεο entreat me not by [clasping] my knees, Il. 22.345.

data.quote: νῦν δέ σε πρὸς πατρὸς γουνάζομαι
νῦν δέ σε τῶν ὄπιθεν γ., . . πρός τʼ ἀλόχου καὶ πατρός

children.definition: supplication, Lyc. 1243:—also γουν-ασμός, ὁ, Eust. 627.9.

definition: γούνατα, γούνασι, Ep. γούνεσσι, etc., v. γόνυ.
γουνιαῖος τόπος, sine expl., Hsch. γουνοννία· σάμψυχος, Id.

children.definition: pres. and impf., γουνοῦμαι Il. 21.74, Od. 6.149, Archil. 75, Anacr. 1.1, etc.; γουνούμην Od. 11.29; γουνοῦσθαι 10.521; γουνούμενος 4.433, etc.
thick-kneed, v.l. γουνο-πᾰγής, cramping the knees, Ἀχλύς Hes. Sc. 266.

high ground, φυτὸν ὣς γουνῷ ἀλωῆς Il. 18.57; ἀνὰ γουνὸν ἀλωῆς οἰνοπέδοιο Od. 1.193, etc.; ἐκ Κρήτης ἐς γουνὸν Ἀθηνάων 11.323; τῆς Ἀττικῆς . . τὸν γ. τὸν Σουνιακόν Hdt. 4.99: pl., γουνοῖσιν Ἐλευθῆρος μεδέουσα Hes. Th. 54; γουνοῖσιν κατένασσε Νεμείης ib. 329; ἐν γουνοῖς Ἀθανᾶν Pi. I. 4(3).25. (Expld. as τόπος γονιμώτατος by Sch. Il. l.c., but better as ὑψηλὸς τόπος (cf. γόνυ) Orion 38, EM 239.5.)

data.quote: τῆς Ἀττικῆς . . τὸν γ. τὸν Σουνιακόν

cake, Sol. 38.3.
cake, Chrysipp.Tyan. ap. Ath. 14.647c.
mournful, ἁρμονίαι Pl. Lg. 800d ( Sup.); φωνή Arist. HA 615b5.
serpent, Peripl.M.Rubr. 38.

definition: γραβάν σκάφιον, βόθρον, Hsch. γράβατος, v. κράβατος.

γράθμα, v. γράμμα.

Adj., of things, old, γραίας ἐρείκης Id. Ag. 295; γραίας ἀκάνθης S. Fr. 868; γραῖαν ὠλένην E. Ion 1213; γραίᾳ χερί Id. Hec. 877; γραιᾶν πηρᾶν Theoc. 15.19; σταφυλὴ γραίη raisins, AP 6.231 ( Phil.).
Γραῖαι, αἱ, the Graiae, with hair grey from their birth, Hes. Th. 270, prob. in A. Fr. 262.

Charito 6.1, PMag.Lond. 125.21 (v A. D.), Palch. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.95.
man like an old woman, Hsch. γραμαιτιτά, γραμματευτά, Hsch.

definition: γράμμα, ατος, τό, Dor. γράθμα, prob. in IG 4.506 ( Heraeum, vi/v B. C.), cf. An.Ox. 1.102, but γράσσμα, IG 4.554 ( Argos, v B. C.): late Aeol. pl. γρόππατα, Epigr.Gr. 990.11 ( Balbilla): ( γράφω):—

children.definition: that which is drawn: pl., lines of a drawing, picture, etc., E. Ion 1146 (of tapestry), Theoc. 15.81; picture, Ἀπέλλεω γ. Herod. 4.73, cf. AP 6.352 ( Erinna): sg., drawing, picture, Pl. R. 472d, Cra. 430e, cf. 431c: pl., figures in a picture, Procop.Gaz. Ecphr. p.157B.

children.label: II
children.definition: written character, letter, Hdt. 1.139, 148, etc.: in pl., letters, characters, γραμμάτων τε συνθέσεις A. Pr. 460; πηλίκοις γ. Ep.Gal. 6.11; the letters, the alphabet, Hdt. 5.58; τὰ γ. καὶ τὰς συλλαβάς Pl. Cra. 390e; γ. Φοινίκια S. Fr. 514; Ἀσσύρια, Ἑλληνικά, Hdt. 4.87; γράμματα ἐπίστασθαι Pl. Lg. 689d; μαθεῖν to have learnt to read, Id. Prt. 325e; γ. μὴ εἰδέναι SIG 2844.6; ἐδίδασκες γράμματα, ἐγὼ δʼ ἐφοίτων you kept school—I went there, D. 18.265; ἤτοι τέθνηκεν ἢ διδάσκει γ. Com.Adesp. 20; παιδεύειν γράμματα Arist. Pol. 1337b24; τέχνη ἡμῶν γ. our profession is that of the scribe, PTeb. 316.16 (i A. D.).

children.label: b
children.definition: articulate sound, letter, Pl. Phlb. 18c; τὰ γ. πάθη ἐστὶ τῆς φωνῆς Arist. Pr. 895a12; γράμματα φθέγγεσθαι ib. 8, cf. PA 660a5.

data.quote: τὰ γ. πάθη ἐστὶ τῆς φωνῆς

children.label: c
children.definition: παρὰ γράμμα λέγοντα . . σκοπεῖν etymologically, Id. MM 1185b39; τὰ παρὰ γ. σκώμματα puns, Id. Rh. 1412a28; but ἀρετὴν παρὰ γ. διώκοντες, with ref. to Νικαρέτη, the mistress of Stilpo, Crates Theb. 1.

children.label: d
children.definition: inscription, τὸ Δελφικὸν γ. Pl. Phdr. 229e, cf. Chrm. 164d, X. Mem. 4.2.24, etc., IG 2.2876, al.: prov., εἰς πέλαγος . . γράμματα γράψαι Epigr.Gr. 1038.8 ( Attalia).
notes in music, AP 11.78 ( Lucill.).
diagram, Epigr. ap. D.L. 8.12.

letter inscribed on the lots which the δικασταί drew, Ar. Pl. 277, al., Arist. Ath. 64.4; practically, = division of dicasts, ἐν ὁποίῳ γ. δειπνεῖ Ar. Ec. 683; ἁ κατὰ γράμμα φυλακά the roster of guards, SIG 569.21 ( Cos, iii B. C.).

children.label: b
children.definition: quarters of a town, PRein. 49.2; accent, EM 240.42, Zonar.
ounce, scruple, Androm. ap. Gal. 13.114, Gp. 7.13.2, PLips. 62 ii 27 (iv A. D.).

children.label: III
children.definition: set of written characters, piece of writing, Hdt. 1.124: hence, letter, Id. 5.14, IG 2(2).103.8, etc.; γραμμάτων πτυχαί S. Fr. 144, cf. E. IT 594, al., Pl. Ep. 347c; inscription, epitaph, etc., ἐκόλαψε ἐς τὸν τάφον γράμματα λέγοντα τάδε Hdt. 1.187, cf. 4.91, And. 3.12, Theoc. 18.47, IG 3.751.

data.quote: ἐκόλαψε ἐς τὸν τάφον γράμματα λέγοντα τάδε

children.definition: papers, documents, Antipho 1.30, D. 36.21, etc. (sg., D.Chr. 65.14); τούτων τὰ γ. the documents to prove this, Lys. 32.14; τὰ γ. τῆς δίκης Ar. Nu. 772; τὰ δημόσια γ. the public records, Decr. ap. D. 18.55; title-deeds, D.C. 65.14; account of loans, D. 49.59; ἐπικαρπίαν ἐν γράμμασιν ἀποφέρειν Pl. Lg. 955d; contract or estimate, BCH 46.323 ( Teos); catalogue, X. Cyr. 7.4.12: in sg., bond, Ev.Luc. 16.7; note of hand, J. AJ 18.6.3.

writings, i.e. book, treatise, τὰ τοῦ Ζήνωνος γ. Pl. Prm. 127c (but sg., ib. 128a): pl., books, X. Mem. 4.2.1; Πλάτωνος τὸ περὶ ψυχῆς γ. Call. Epigr. 25, cf. AP 9.63 ( Asclep.), Gal. 18(2).928; τὰ ἱερὰ γ. the Holy Scriptures, OGI 56.36 (iii B. C.), Ph. 2.574, 2 Ep.Ti. 3.15, J. Ap. 1.10; ἱερὰ γ., = Imperial rescripts, IG 12(5).132 ( Paros, iii A. D.); = hieroglyphics, OGI 90.54 ( Rosetta, ii B. C.): in sg., the Law of Moses, Ep.Rom. 2.27, al.; opp. πνεῦμα, ib. 29: sg., article of a treaty, Th. 5.29.

laws or rules, Pl. R. 425b, Plt. 292a, al., Ar. Ec. 1050; κατὰ γράμματα ἄρχειν, opp. ἄνευ γραμμάτων, Pl. Plt. 293a; ἡ κατὰ γ. καὶ νόμους πολιτεία Arist. Pol. 1286a15, cf. 1272a38: οἱ κατὰ γ. νόμοι, opp. οἱ κατὰ τὰ ἔθη, ib. 1287b5, cf. Pl. Plt. 299d; κατὰ γράμματα ἰατρεύεσθαι Arist. Pol. 1287a34; ἡ ἐκ τῶν γ. θεραπεία ib. 40.

data.quote: ἡ κατὰ γ. καὶ νόμους πολιτεία

children.label: IV
children.definition: letters, learning, ἀπείρους γραμμάτων Pl. Ap. 26d, etc.
weight of two obols, Aët. 7.117.
office of γραμματεύς, PTeb. 30.18 (ii B. C.), Plu. Comp.Eum.Sert. 1, BGU 587.11 (ii A. D.); the term of such office, JRS 2.243 ( Phrygia).

children.label: II
children.definition: learning, LXX Si. 44.4.

Dim. of γραμματεῖον, small tablet, Antipho 5.53, D. 54.37, Thphr. Char. 6.8, Plu. Brut. 5, etc.; γ. δίθυρον Men. 327; menu, Ath. 2.49d; memorandum, Jul. ad Ath. 277b. ( γραμματίδιον which is freq. found in codd., cf. PLips. 111.5 (iv A. D.), is expl. as Dim. of γράμματα by Gramm., cf. Hdn.Gr. 2.488.)
a maker of tablets, title of plays by Apollodorus of Carystus ( Ath. 7.280d) and Apollodorus of Gela ( Poll. 4.19).

that on which one writes, tablets, Ar. Fr. 157, Antipho 1.10, Pl. Prt. 326d, prob. in Gorg. Pal. 6; tablet on which names, etc., are recorded, λελευκωμένα γ. Arist. Ath. 47.2, cf. D. 46.11, IG 1(2).91.11, etc.
bond, document, contract, Lys. 32.7; κατὰ γραμματεῖον ἡταιρηκέναι Aeschin. 1.165, cf. POxy. 1012 Fr. 9 ii 15; account-book, ledger, Ar. Nu. 19, D. 45.33: freq. written γραμμάτιον.
τὸ ληξιαρχικὸν γ. list in which Athenian citizens were enrolled, IG 1(2).79, Is. 7.27, D. 57.26.
will, testament, Is. 6.29.
pass(?), PPetr. 3p.130.
memorandum, D. 22.23, Jul. ad Ath. 283b; petition, Luc. Peregr. 16.

children.label: II
children.definition: place where γράμματα were taught, a school, Anon. ap. Suid.

children.label: III
children.definition: office of γραμματεύς, Plb. 4.87.8, Poll. 9.41.

children.label: IV
children.definition: public dining-hall in Syria, Posidon. 18.

secretary, registrar, title of officials at Athens and elsewhere, IG 1(2).15, etc.; ὁ γ. ὁ τῆς πόλεως Th. 7.10; γ. τοῦ δήμου OGI 493.10 ( Ephesus, ii A. D.), Act.Ap. 19.35; γ. ἀνδραπόδων PHib. 29.7; γ. τῶν μαχίμων UPZ 110.145 (ii B. C.); γ. τοῦ θεοῦ IG 9(2).1109.21 ( Magn. Thess.); also of subordinate officials, clerk, sts. a term of contempt, ὄλεθρος γ. D. 18.127; θεοῖς ἐχθρὸς καὶ γ. Id. 19.95; ἡ γ., in joke, Ar. Th. 432.
recorder, of memory, Pl. Phlb. 39a.
scholar, γ. σαφής A. Fr. 358 (s. v. l.).
one who traces or marks out, of Egyptian embalmers, D.S. 1.91.
to be secretary, hold his office, IG 1(2).392, Th. 4.118, etc.: c. dat., IG 1(2).352, etc.; later, c. gen., γ. τοῦ συνεδρίου IG 3.752.
letter-carrier, D.H. 20.4, Plu. Galb. 8, al., PFlor. 39.6 (iv A. D.), etc.

definition: γραμματίας (sc. λίθος), ου, ὁ, precious stone like an emerald, v.l. in Plin. HN 37.118:— Hsch. has γραμματίας· περιεσπασμένους.

children.definition: teach the spelling of a word, Herod. 3.24:— Pass., pf. to be skilled in γράμματα, Hsch.; γραμματισμένος (sic) man of education, Cat.Cod.Astr. 6.65.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be a secretary, συνέδροις IG 5(1).1432.19 ( Messene); Boeot. γραμματίδδοντος IG 7.1739 ( Thespiae), al.
to be a grammarian, AP 9.169 ( Pall.).
scourge of critics, title of Aus. Idyll. 14.

knowing oneʼs letters, a good scholar, X. Mem. 4.2.20, Pl. Tht. 207b, Arist. EN 1105a21: Comp., Pl. Plt. 285d, Ph. 1.621; opp. ἀγράμματος, Arr. Epict. 3.19.6; ἀνὴρ γ. Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.582a. Adv. -κῶς Pl. Tht. l.c., etc.
γ. ἔκπωμα a cup engraved with the alphabet or an inscription, Eub. 69, cf. Ath. 11.466d, Luc. Lex. 7.
γ. ἀνάγκαι f.l. for γραμμικαί, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.46.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., γραμματικός, ὁ, teacher of the rudiments, Hp. Epid. 4.37, Plu. Adul. 2.59f:—fem. -κή, Sammelb. 5753.

one who occupies himself with literary texts, grammarian, critic, Plb. 32.2.5, D.L. 3.61, D.Chr. 53.1, IG 14.1183, etc.; first used of Apollodorus of Cyrene, acc. to Clem.Al. Strom. 1.16.79:—fem. -κή, ἡ, Ath. 1.14d.
concerned with textual criticism, ἐξήγησις D.H. Th. 51; γραμματικά, title of work by Eratosthenes, Clem.Al. l.c.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἡ -κή (with or without τέχνη) grammar, Pl. Cra. 431e, Sph. 253a, etc.; ἡ γ. ἐπιστήμη Arist. Top. 142b31.

children.label: b
children.definition: faculty of scholarship, γ. ἐστιν ἕξις παντελὴς ἐν γράμμασι Eratosth. ap. Sch. D.T. p.160 H., cf. Ph. 1.502, AP 7.588 ( Paul.Sil.).

data.quote: γ. ἐστιν ἕξις παντελὴς ἐν γράμμασι

children.definition: alphabet, script, Str. 3.1.6, Plu. Arist. 1, etc.; ἡ ἱερὰ γ. hieroglyphic writing, OGI 56.64 (iii B. C.).

children.label: IV
children.definition: γραμματικόν, τό, fee paid to scribes in Egypt, PHib. 1.110 (iii B. C.), PTeb. 61b. 89 (ii B. C.), etc.

definition: γραμμάτιον, τό, Dim. of γράμμα, Luc. Merc.Cond. 36.

children.label: II
children.definition: bond, contract, POxy. 71.5 (iv A. D.).
limpidus (sic), Gloss. (Perh. plinthium.)
clerk, registrar, Hdt. 2.28, 3.123, IG 7.1745 ( Thespiae), SIG 529.4 ( Dyme, iii B. C.), etc.: metaph., recorder, of memory (cf. γραμματεύς 2), Pl. Phlb. 39b.

children.label: II
children.definition: one who teaches γράμματα, elementary schoolmaster, X. Smp. 4.27, Pl. Prt. 312b, al., D. 19.281, D.H. 11.28, Diog.Oen. 11, etc.
elementary teaching, Phld. Rh. 1.70S., S.E. M. 1.44, Them. Or. 23.297d (also -κά, τά, Id. Or. 21.251a): but distd. fr. γραμματική as more elementary, Ph. 1.540.
Plu. QConv. 2.712a, al.
schoolmaster, SIG 578.8 ( Teos), Teles p. 50 H., Phld. Acad.Ind. p.24 M., Plu. Alc. 7, Porph. Plot. 3, BGU 1214.4; cf. γραμμοδιδασκαλίδης.
line-like, διαφύσεις Sch. Il. 21.169.
inscribed, στήλη Rev.Phil. 46.127 ( Miscamus).
schoolmaster: governor, LXX De. 1.15, al.

definition: γραμματοκύφων [ ῡ], ωνος, nickname of a γραμματεύς,

children.definition: porer over records, D. 18.209, Ph. 2.536: pl., ib. 520.
puzzle-headed grammarian, AP 11.140 ( Lucill.).
map-maker, Sch. D.P. 5.
carry or deliver letters, Str. 5.4.13.
letter-carrier, Plb. 2.61.4, al., Plu. Pel. 10.

definition: γραμματοφυλακεῖον, τό, = sq. 1, J. BJ 2.17.6, Plu. Curios. 2.520c, S.E. M. 2.27.

children.definition: a place for keeping records, Plu. Arist. 21, OGI 669.23 (i A. D.), IG 5(2).516 ( Lycosura, i A. D.), 5(1).20 ( Sparta, ii A. D.): in pl., τὰ τῆς πόλεως γ. BGU 913.4 (iii A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: deed-box, EM 412.38.
recorder, registrar, IG 5(1).32 B 17 ( Sparta), OGI 229.51 ( Smyrna), Test.Epict. 8.27.

stroke or line of a pen, line, as in mathematical figures, γραμμῆς λόγος ὁ τῶν δύο Pythagorei ap. Arist. Metaph. 1036b12, cf. Pl. Men. 82c, R. 509d, etc.; περὶ ἀλόγων γ. title of work by Democritus, περὶ ἀτόμων γ., title of work ascribed to Arist.: hence γραμμαί, αἱ, astronomy, AP 9.344 ( Leon.); also in forming letters, line traced by teacher, Pl. Prt. 326d; outline, opp. σκιά, Metop. ap. Stob. 3.1.116, cf. Plb. 2.14.8; ἡ ἐκτὸς γ. Hero Aut. 27.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: line across the course, starting- or winning-point, Pi. P. 9.118, cf. Ar. Ach. 483; εὐθὺς ἀπὸ γ. Lib. Or. 59.13: metaph. of life, πέλας γραμμῆς ἱκέσθαι E. El. 956; ἐπʼ ἄκραν ἥκομεν γ. κακῶν Id. Fr. 169; ἡ ἐσχάτη τοῦ βίου γ. D.S. 17.118: hence, boundary-line, edge, dub. l. in Hp. Art. 80; cutting edge of a knife, Gal. 2.673.

children.label: III
children.definition: line or square on a chequer-board: hence prov., τὸν ἀπὸ γραμμᾶς κινεῖν λίθον to move a piece from this line, i. e. try oneʼs last chance, Theoc. 6.18 (usu. called ἡ ἱερά (sc. γραμμή), cf. ἱερός) ; αἱ γ. the board itself, Poll. 9.99.
διὰ γραμμῆς παίζειν to play at tug-of-war ( διελκυστίνδα), Pl.Com. 153.1, Pl. Tht. 181a.

children.label: IV
children.definition: ἡ μακρά (sc. γραμμή), v. τιμάω III.1.

children.label: V
children.definition: linea alba, Gal. 2.514.
Hippiatr. 1.
linear, σχῆμα Dam. Pr. 262.

definition: γραμμίζω, prob. f.l. for διαγραμμίζω, of a game (cf. γραμμή ΙΙΙ.1), Eust. 633.63.

children.definition: linear, geometrical, θεωρία Gal. UP 10.12; ἀπόδειξις Plu. Marc. 14, Theol.Ar. 26; ἀνάγκαι Olymp. in Grg. p.260 J. Adv. -κῶς by means of lines, geometrically, ἀποδείκνυσθαι S.E. M. 3.92, cf. Ptol. Alm. 2.12, Procl. in R. 2.27 K.
γ. ἀριθμός linear number, Nicom. Ar. 2.7, cf. Speus. ap. Theol.Ar. 61.

children.label: II
children.definition: Plu. Exil. 2.606c (s.v.l.).
a surgical instrument, Hermes 38.281.
chequered, Eust. 852.11.
Timo 51.
slender as a line, φῶς Paul.Al. G. 4. Adv. -δῶς in wavy lines, Arist. Mu. 395a27.
striped, Arist. Fr. 295.
act of writing, Hdn.Gr. 1.168.
mother of lines, μέλασμα, of the leaden plummet, AP 6.63 ( Damoch.).
wiry, Thphr. HP 4.12.2; with linear markings, ib. 7.3.2.
old wifeʼs talk, gossip, γραμματικὴ γ. S.E. M. 1.141: pl., Porph. Chr. 34.
lover of old women, Ar. Pax 812; cf. Sch.ad loc., and v. σοβάς.

data.ref: Ar. Pax 812; cf. Sch.ad loc., and v. σοβάς.

children.definition: gossip-monger, Suid. s.v. Τίμαιος.
reared by an old woman, coddled, Eust. 971.41.
lover of old women, Sch. Ar. Pax 812.
cast slough of serpents, etc., Hsch.
wrinkled, S. Ichn. 177, EM 239.31.
bird, Hsch.
one must write or describe, ὅπως . . X. Eq. 2.1; one must write, spell, Str. 9.4.5, Gal. 15.720.
γραπτέος, α, ον, to be written, described, Pl. Ep. 341d, Luc. Im. 17.
writer, AP 6.66 ( Paul.Sil.), Man. 1.132 (pl.).
wrinkled, Eust. 633.56.
painted, ζῷα Emp. 128.5; τύποι E. Fr. 764; κύρβις Achae. 19; εἰκών SIG 1068.21 ( Patmos): γραπτά, τά, paintings, opp. γλυπτά, D.H. Comp. 25.
marked as with letters, ἁ γραπτὰ ὑάκινθος Theoc. 10.28; γ. λίθος IG 14.1089.

children.label: II
children.definition: written, νόμοι γ. Gorg. Pal. 30, cf. Pl. Lg. 773e, etc.; ἀσφάλεια PAmh. 78.17 (ii A. D.): γραπτά, τά, rescripts, proclamations, LXX 2 Ma 11.15; legal documents, bonds, Man. 3.214.
fee for writing or copying, PLond.ined. 2110 (ii A. D.), BGU 1062.20 (iii A. D.), POxy. 895.12 (iv A. D.).
scratching, tearing, Od. 24.229 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: writings, A.R. 4.279.
smell of a goat: hence, of men, A. or Ar. ap. Phot. s.v. ψό, Eup. 242, Arist. Pr. 879a23, Plu. Apophth.reg. 2.180c, M.Ant. 9.36.
feed at grass, ἵππους Gp. 16.1.11 ( Pass.), Hippiatr. 98.
feeding at grass, Hippiatr. 10.
grass, green fodder, PPetr. 2p.113 (corr. in 3p.333) (iii B. C.), etc.; γ. πυρίνη, κριθίνη, Hippiatr. 68,98, cf. Eust. 633.47, Hsch.:—also γράσσις, PHamb. 39 ii (ii A. D.); cf. κράστις.
smelling like a goat, M.Ant. 11.15, Ath. 13.585e; a term of abuse, Hsch.
Archig. ap. Aët. 8.7 (pl.).

definition: γραῦις, ιδος, ἡ, Dor. for γρηῦς, γραῦς, Call. Fr. 326.
γραῦς, gen. γρᾱός, ἡ: Ion. γρηῦς, γρηός, voc. γρηῦ: poet. also γρηΰς, voc. γρηΰ: barbarous voc. γρᾶο in Ar. Th. 1222: nom. pl. γρᾶες Ar. Fr. 350, Timocl. 25: acc. γραῦς E. Andr. 612, etc.:—

children.definition: old woman, Hom., esp. in Od., 1.191, al., A. Eu. 38, etc.; γ. παλαιή Od. 19.346: prov., γραῶν ὕθλος old wives’ fables, Pl. Tht. 176b: with Subst., γ. γυνή E. Tr. 490, Ar. Th. 345, D. 19.283: Com., ὁ γραῦς of an old man, Ar. Th. 1214 cod. R.

children.label: II
children.definition: scum of boiled milk, Id. Pl. 1206, Arist. GA 743b7.

children.label: III
children.definition: sea-crab, Arist. HA 601a18 (as v.l.), Artem. 2.14.

children.label: IV
children.definition: locust, γ. σέριφος Zen. 2.94.

definition: γραφείδιον (or -ίδιον), τό, Dim. of sq., Isoc. ap. Theon Prog. 5, EM 240.16, Suid.

children.definition: pencil, Hp. Superf. 8 (f.l.), Arist. Ph. 248b8, Macho ap. Ath. 13.582c.
paint-brush, Plu. Herod. 2.859e, S.E. P. 1.28; graving tool, chisel, Epigr.Gr. 980.4 ( Philae).

children.label: II
children.definition: registry, record-office, Michel 595.12 (Halic.), PRyl. 65.4 (i B. C.), PAmh. 110.21 (i A. D.), etc.:—written γράφιον, PPetr. 3p.155.

children.label: III
children.definition: tax on writing-materials, BGU 277 ii 11: but in pl., fees for copying, ib. 1214.12.
painter, Emp. 23.1, E. Hec. 807 (s. v. l.), And. 4.17, Pl. Phd. 110b, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: X. HG 4.1.39, Plu. Ages. 13; private secretary, τοῦ Δημοκρίτου Epicur. Fr. 172.

children.label: III
children.definition: writer, D.S. 21.17; scribe, scrivener, X. Ages. 1.26; copyist, Arist. Rh. 1409a20, Plb. 12.4a. 4, Str. 13.1.54 (pl.); τὰ τῶν γραφέων πταίσματα Porph. Plot. 19; cf. γραφής, γροφεύς.
representation by means of lines: hence,

children.label: I
children.definition: drawing, delineation, Hdt. 4.36; κατὰ γραφήν in outline, cj. in Pl. Smp. 193a; also of painting, γραφῇ κοσμέειν Hdt. 3.24; εἰκὼν γραφῇ εἰκασμένη Id. 2.182; the art of drawing or painting, Pl. Plt. 277c, Ti. 19b.

that which is drawn or painted, drawing, picture, ὅσον γραφῇ only in a picture, Hdt. 2.73; πρέπουσά θʼ ὡς ἐν γραφαῖς A. Ag. 242 (lyr.); σπόγγος ὤλεσεν γραφήν ib. 1329; μήτε ἄγαλμα μήτε γ. Arist. Pol. 1336b15; also of embroidery, A. Ch. 232; γραφαὶ ἀπὸ κερκίδος Philostr. Im. 2.5.
γ. παρειῶν painting, rouging the cheeks, Id. Ep. 22.

children.label: II
children.definition: writing or the art of writing, Pl. Phdr. 274b, etc.: pl., αἱ γ. τῶν δικῶν the registration of . . , Arist. Pol. 1321b36; γραφαὶ περὶ συμμαχίας, of treaties, ib. 1280a40.

that which is written, writing, S. Tr. 683, Agatho 4: hence, of various written documents, letter, Th. 1.129: also in pl., E. IT 735; ψευδεῖς γ. spurious documents, ap. D. 18.55 (but in E. Hipp. 1311 false statements); of published writings, τῶν φιλοσόφων Phld. Ir. p.73 W., cf. D.H. Orat.Vett. 4; ἐν τῇ πρώτῃ γ. in the first book, Epicur. Nat.Herc. 1431.16; written law, Pl. Lg. 934c; contract, PAmh. 2.43.13 (ii B. C.): pl., copies of judgements delivered in court, IG 12(2).526d8 ( Eresos).

data.ref: Agatho 4: hence, of various written documents,

children.label: b
children.definition: catalogue, list, return, ἱερῶν PTeb. 88.2 (ii B. C.); τοῦ κατʼ ἄνδρα OGI 179.21 ( Egypt, i B. C.); τὰς κατʼ ἄνδρα γραφάς PTeb. 27.7 (ii B. C.), etc.; price-list, D.S. 1.91.

children.label: c
children.definition: inscription, Th. 1.134, IG 12(5).679 ( Syros), Epigr.Gr. 347 ( Cios), D.C. 37.21.

children.label: d

children.label: III
children.definition: γράφομαι) as law-term,
bill of indictment in a public prosecution, λέγε, τὴν γ. αὐτὴν λαβών D. 18.53.

criminal prosecution in the interest of the state (cf. Poll. 8.41), γραφὴν ὕβρεως καὶ δίκην κακηγορίας ἰδίαν φεύξεται Id. 21.32, cf. Lys. 1.44, Is. 11.28, etc.; γραφὴν γράφεσθαι Pl. Lg. 929e, etc.; γρ. γ. τινά Id. Euthphr. 2b, etc.; γ. ἀπενεγκεῖν Aeschin. 3.217; γραφήν τινος διώκειν τινά D. 19.293; πολλὰς γ. διώξας οὐδεμίαν εἷλεν Antipho 2.1.5; γραφὴν ἁλῶναι Id. 2.2.9; γ. κατασκευάζειν κατά τινος, ἐπί τινα, D. 21.103, 22.2; γ. εἰσέρχεσθαι, εἰσιέναι, appear before the court in a public prosecution, either as prosecutor or prosecuted, Id. 18.105.

data.quote: γραφὴν ὕβρεως καὶ δίκην κακηγορίας ἰδίαν φεύξεται

children.definition: an ordinary public action, opp. to special forms (such as εἰσαγγελία, εὔθυναι, etc.), γραφάς, εὐθύνας, εἰσαγγελίας, πάντα ταῦτʼ ἐπαγόντων μοι D. 18.249, cf. X. Ath. 3.2, Lys. 16.12.

data.quote: γραφάς, εὐθύνας, εἰσαγγελίας, πάντα ταῦτʼ ἐπαγόντων μοι

children.definition: IG 5(2).8 ( Tegea, iv B. C.), al.
Gloss.
capable of drawing or painting, Pl. Tht. 144e, Ael. VH 14.37: Comp., a better judge of painting, ib. 2.3: -κή (sc. τέχνη), ἡ, the art of painting, Pl. Grg. 450c, etc.
as if painted, Ἔρωτες Plu. Ant. 26 (so Adv. -κῶς ibid., 2.747c, Luc. Im. 15); picturesque, πρόσοψις D.S. 2.53.

children.label: II
children.definition: of or for writing, suited for writing: -κή, ἡ, the art of writing, Hp. VM 20; γ. λέξις, opp. ἀγωνιστική, Arist. Rh. 1413b8; δύναμις Alcid. Soph. 29; γ. ῥέεθρον, i.e. ink, AP 6.63 ( Damoch.); κάλαμος Gp. 10.75.8, PGrenf. 2.38.7 (i A. D.); μέλαν Gal. 6.565; in writing, γ. ἁμάρτημα a clerical error, Plb. 34.3.11.
skilled in writing, Arr. Epict. 2.18.2; shorthand writer, IG 14.1528.
able to describe, Plu. Herod. 2.874b, Luc. Alex. 3; of style, graphic, lively, D.H. Amm. 1.4; ὑπόθεσις γ. a subject for description, Plu. Alex. 17.
like a stylus, γ. ἔκφυσις styloid process of the temporal bone, Gal. UP 7.19, 11.4.
case for γραφεῖα, Gloss.

AP 6.63 ( Damoch.), 65 ( Paul.Sil.), 67 ( Jul.): esp. stilus for writing on waxen tablets, Pl. Prt. 326d; paint-brush, APl. 16.178 (Antip.); graving tool, LXX Ex. 32.4; σύμβολα . . γραφίδεσσι κατέξυσα Hymn.Is. 11, cf. AP 4.3b.72 ( Agath.); needle for embroidering, APl. 16.324.

children.label: II
children.definition: embroidery, AP 5.275 ( Agath.): but in pl., = paintings, Nonn. D. 25.433.
surgical instrument for extracting arrows, etc., Cels. 7.5.3.
styloid process of the ulna, Gal. 2.252,271.
SIG 9 ( Olympia, vi B. C.), IG 5(2).343 (Orchom. Arc., iv B. C.).

definition: γράφω [ᾰ], fut. -ψω Hdt. 1.95, etc.: aor. ἔγραψα, Ep. γράψα Il. 17.599: pf. γέγραφα Cratin. 124, Th. 5.26, etc.; later γεγράφηκα PHib. 1.78.2 (iii B. C.):— Med., fut. γράψομαι Ar. Pax 107, etc. (but in pass. sense, Gal. Protr. 13): aor. ἐγραψάμην Ar. V. 894, etc.:— Pass., fut. γρᾰφήσομαι Hp. Acut. 26, Nicom.Com. 1.39, ( μετεγ-) Ar. Eq. 1370; more freq. γεγράψομαι S. OT 411, Theoc. 18.47, etc.: aor. ἐγράφην [ᾰ], Hdt. 4.91, Pl. Prm. 128c, etc.; ἐγράφθην SIG 57.5 ( Milet., v B. C.), Archim. Fluit. 2.4: pf. γέγραμμαι (also in med. sense, v. fin.), 3 sg. ἔγραπται Opp. C. 3.274; part. ἐγραμμένος or ἠγρ- SIG 9 (Elis, dub.), Leg.Gort. 1.45, al.; later γεγράφημαι Ph. 2.637: 3 pl. γεγράφαται IG 1(2).57.10, Dor. γεγράβανται Schwyzer 90.12 ( Argos): plpf. ἐγέγραπτο X. Mem. 1.2.64: 3 pl. ἐγεγράφατο D.C. 56.32. Used by Hom. only in aor. Act.:—

children.definition: scratch, graze, αἰχμὴ γράψεν οἱ ὀστέον ἄχρις Il. 17.599; γράψας ἐν πίνακι πτυκτῷ θυμοφθόρα πολλά having marked or drawn signs thereon, 6.169: hence, later, represent by lines, draw, paint, Hdt. 2.41, A. Eu. 50, Pl. R. 377e; γῆς περιόδους γ. draw maps, Hdt. 4.36; γ. Ἔρωθʼ ὑπόπτερον Eub. 41.1; προσπεπατταλευμένον γ. τὸν Προμηθέα Men. 535.2; ἀνδριάντα γ. Pl. R. 420c; ζῷα γ., = ζωγραφεῖν (q. v.), Id. Grg. 453c: metaph., ὁπόσα τοὺς λειμῶνας αἱ ὧραι γράφουσι Philostr. Im. Praef.:— Med., ζῷα γράφεσθαι Hdt. 4.88:— Pass., εἰκὼν γεγραμμένη Ar. Ra. 537; πίνακες γεγραμμένοι τὰ Ἀλεξάνδρου ἔργα Philostr. VA 2.20.

data.quote: ὁπόσα τοὺς λειμῶνας αἱ ὧραι γράφουσι

children.definition: describe a figure, Euc. Post. 3, al., Archim. Sph.Cyl. 1.23, al., Gal. 1.47.

children.label: b
children.definition: generate a figure, Arist. Mech. 848b10, al.; τὸ σαμεῖον ἕλικα γράψει Archim. Sph.Cyl. 1, cf. Apollon.Perg. Con. 1.2, Hero Aut. 8.1.
brand, mark, Opp. C. 1.326:— Pass. in form γεγράφαται, ib. 322.

children.label: II
children.definition: express by written characters, write, τι Hdt. 1.125, etc.; γ. διαθήκην Pl. Lg. 923c, cf. X. Cyr. 4.5.34 ( Pass.); γ. τινὶ ὅτι . . Th. 7.14; γ. τινί, c. inf., SIG 552.13 ( Abae, iii B. C.); γ. τι εἰς διφθέρας Hdt. 5.58: prov., ὅρκους . . γυναικὸς εἰς ὕδωρ γράφω S. Fr. 811, cf. Xenarch. 6; εἰς τέφραν γ. Philonid. 7; εἰς ὕδωρ, ἐν ὕδατι, Men. Mon. 25, Pl. Phdr. 276c; ἐν χρυσῷ πίνακι Id. Criti. 120c; ἐν φλοιῷ Theoc. 18.47; καθʼ ὕδατος Luc. Cat. 21; εἰς πέλαγος γράμματα γράψαι Epigr.Gr. 1038.8 ( Attalia):— Pass., πόθι φρενὸς γέγραπται in what leaf of memory it is written, Pi. O. 10(11).3.

inscribe, γ. εἰς σκῦλα, εἰς στήλην, E. Ph. 574, D. 9.41:— Pass., γράφεσθαί τι to be inscribed with a thing, S. Tr. 157; ὧδε γέγραμμαι have my name inscribed, IG 12(7).3* (dub.); ἐν τῷ προσώπῳ γραφεὶς τὴν συμφοράν having it branded on his forehead, Pl. Lg. 854d; γεγραμμένα κωκύουσαν, of the hyacinth, Euph. 40.

write down, γ. τινὰ αἴτιον set him down as the cause, Hdt. 7.214; γ. τι ἱερόν τινι register as . . , Pi. O. 3.30; in magic, invoke a curse upon, Tab.Defix.Aud. 14 A 1; γ. τινὰ κληρονόμον, ἐπίτροπον, institute by a written document, Pl. Lg. 923c, 924a; register, enrol, ἐμὲ γράφε τῶν ἱππεύειν ὑπερεπιθυμούντων X. Cyr. 4.3.21; οὐ Κρέοντος προστάτου γεγράψομαι, as a dependent of Cr., S. OT 411.
γ. τινί write a letter to one, γ. σοὶ ἵνα εἰδῇς PGrenf. 1.11 ii 21 (ii B. C.), etc.; εἴς τινα Luc. Syr.D. 23.

γ. περί τίνος write on a subject, X. Cyn. 13.2, etc.; ὑπέρ τινος Plb. 1.1.4, etc.; εἴς τινα against . . , Longin. 4.3; πρός τινα address a work to . . , Id. 1.3; describe, οἱ ὑφʼ ἡμῶν γραφόμενοι καιροί Plb. 2.56.4; esp. of Prose, opp. ποιεῖν, Isoc. 2.48: c. dupl. acc., τί . . γράψειειν ἄν σε μουσοποιὸς ἐν τάφῳ ; E. Tr. 1189.

data.quote: τί . . γράψειειν ἄν σε μουσοποιὸς ἐν τάφῳ ;

children.definition: write down a law to be proposed: hence, propose, move, γνώμην, νόμον, ψήφισμα, etc., X. HG 1.7.34, Ar. Nu. 1429, etc.: abs. (sc. νόμον), D. 18.179; γ. καὶ νομοθετεῖν περί τινος Id. 24.48; γ. πόλεμον, εἰρήνην, Id. 10.55, 19.55: c. inf., σὺ γράφεις ταῦτʼ εἶναι στρατιωτικά Id. 1.19; ἔγραψα . . ἀποπλεῖν . . τοὺς πρέσβεις Id. 18.25; enact, νόμοι οὓς τὸ πλῆθος συνελθὸν ἔγραψε X. Mem. 1.2.42:— Pass., παρὰ τὰ γραφέντα δρᾶν Pl. Plt. 295d; τὸ γεγραμμένον ὑπὸ σοῦ ψήφισμα Din. 1.70.

data.quote: νόμοι οὓς τὸ πλῆθος συνελθὸν ἔγραψε

children.definition: prescribe, ordain, πότμος ἔγραψε Pi. N. 6.7.
ὁ γράφων τὸν Ὀξυρυγχίτην (sc. νομόν) the secretary for the nome of Oxyrhynchus, POxy. 239.1 (i A. D.); τῷ ἰδίῳ λόγῳ γράφοντι τὸν νομόν PFlor. 358.5 (ii A. D.).

data.quote: τῷ ἰδίῳ λόγῳ γράφοντι τὸν νομόν

children.label: B
children.definition: Med., write for oneself or for oneʼs own use, note down, Hdt. 2.82, IG 1(2).57.39, etc.; γ. τι ἐν φρεσίν A. Ch. 450 (lyr.); φρενῶν ἔσω S. Ph. 1325; ἐγραψάμην ὑπομνήματα I wrote me down some memoranda, Pl. Tht. 143a; cause to be written, συγγραφήν D. 56.6, etc.; γ. πρόσοδον πρὸς τὴν βουλήν petition for a hearing before the Council, Id. 24.48.

enrol oneself, γράψασθαι φυλῆς καὶ δήμου καὶ φρατρίας IG 1(2).374.16, ib. 2.115b21: abs., of colonists, Pl. Lg. 850b; but also (cf. A.II.3), ἕνα τῶν μαθητῶν ἐμὲ γράφου enrol me as one of your disciples, Id. Cra. 428b.

data.quote: γράψασθαι φυλῆς καὶ δήμου καὶ φρατρίας

children.definition: γ. τινά to indict one, τινός for some public offence, e.g. τῆς αἰσχροκερδείας, Pl. Lg. 754e; γ. [τινὰ] παρανόμων D. 18.13; in full, γραφὴν γράψασθαί τινα Ar. Nu. 1482 (but in Pass., εἴ σοι γράφοιτο δίκη ib. 758); γράψασθαι δίκας SIG 344.38 ( Teos): c. acc. et inf., γ. τινὰ ἀδικεῖν Ar. V. 894, cf. Pax 107: abs., οἱ γραψάμενοι the prosecutors, Id. V. 881; ἑτέροις οὐκ ἦν γράψασθαι And. 1.75; also γράφεσθαί τι indict an act, i. e. the doer of it, as criminal, ἐγράψατο τὴν Χαβρίου δωρειάν he brought a γραφὴ παρανόμων against the person who proposed the grant to Chabrias, D. 20.146, cf. 95; τὸ χάριν τούτων ἀποδοῦναι παρανόμων γράφει ( 2 sg.) Id. 18.119.

children.label: b
children.definition: Pass., to be indicted, γραφεὶς ἀπέφυγον D. 18.103; τοῦτο τὸ ψήφισμα ἐγράφη παρανόμων was indicted as illegal, Aeschin. 3.62; ψηφίσματα ὑπὸ τούτου οὐδὲ γραφέντα not even indicted, D. 18.222 (but in 18.28, εἰ μὴ τοῦτʼ ἐγράφη if this decree had not been proposed, as Pass. of A. II.6); τὰ γεγραμμένα the articles of the indictment, Id. 18.56; τὸ γεγραμμένον the penalty named in the indictment, Id. 24.83:—but γέγραμμαι usu. takes the sense of the Med., indict, Id. 18.59, 119, cf. Pl. Euthphr. 2b, Tht. 210d.
crab, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath. 3.106d.
gnaw, eat, Call. Fr. 200: hence γρά· φάγε (Cypr.), Hsch.; γράσθι (imper.), Inscr.Cypr. 144 H.( Golgoi). (Cf. γράστις, Skt. grásati ‘devourʼ?)
Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.255; μυθολογία Str. 1.2.3; μυθάριον Cleom. 2.1, cf. Iamb. VP 23, 105, 1 Ep.Ti. 4.7: Comp. -έστερος Gal. 5.315.
